question: Common channel signaling provides that

options.A: Control equipment of switching centers exchange signaling information in packet switching
options.B: Each channel dedicated to user data transmission is associated with a different channel for signaling
options.C: Signaling between switching centers occurs by sharing a single satellite channel

correct_answer_content: Control equipment of switching centers exchange signaling information in packet switching
hint: In the common channel signaling the user information travels on separate channels but with a single signaling channel used to control the reporting of all user channels. The channel signaling works in packet.

question: The characteristics of a fully connected mesh topology are

options.A: High number of channels, good fault tolerance, easy routing
options.B: High number of channels, good fault tolerance, difficult routing
options.C: Low number of channels, bad fault tolerance, difficult routing

correct_answer_content: High number of channels, good fault tolerance, easy routing
hint: See slides "Knitted topology". There is always a way in the fully connected mesh direct between each node.

question: Conversational interactive telecommunication services are characterized by

options.A: Low probability of error in the transfer of information
options.B: Transfer of information in real time
options.C: Storage of information on the network and delivery to the recipient in a deferred time

correct_answer_content: Transfer of information in real time
hint: In conversational interactive services, communication takes place with the transfer of extreme to extreme information in real time. See slides “Conversational Interactive Services”.

question: In packet-switched networks the factors that lead to the choice of small packets dimensions are

options.A: Lower impact of control information, higher efficiency in the transfer of big SDUs
options.B: Better chance of parallelization, less transfer delay, less chance of bit error
options.C: Better chance of parallelization, less delay in packaging, less probability of package error

correct_answer_content: Better chance of parallelization, less delay in packaging, less probability of package error
hint: Short packets favor transmission in parallel on different channels of packets of the same communication, short packets reduce the delay of packetization, long packets reduce the percentage of control information.

question: In the OSI model, the transport layer provides services

options.A: Building on services from the application layer
options.B: Relying on the services provided by the network layer
options.C: Relying on the services provided by the session level

correct_answer_content: Relying on the services provided by the network layer
hint: Think of the ISO / OSI stack. See slides on the OSI model.

question: Which of the following statements conforms to the ISO / OSI reference model?

options.A: An (N)-entity and an (N-1)-entity can have the same address
options.B: One (N)-entity can be associated with two different (N-1)-addresses
options.C: Two (N)-entities can be associated with the same (N-1)-address

correct_answer_content: One (N)-entity can be associated with two different (N-1)-addresses
hint: Each entity is characterized by the abbreviation (address) of its own layer, so A and C are wrong and by exclusion the correct answer is B. Internet source.

question: In a Go-Back-N windowed protocol it may be convenient to increase the size of the transmission window

options.A: When the transmission speed increases at the same size of the data units and the same delays
options.B: When the transmission speed decreases at the same size of the data units and the same delays
options.C: When the distance between transmitter and receiver decreases
options.D: When the probability of channel error increases

correct_answer_content: When the transmission speed increases at the same size of the data units and the same delays
hint: Efficiency of a window protocol. Wt = k*(1 + 2*(tp/tx)). As the transmission speed increases, tx decreases, requiring Wt to increase to maintain efficiency.

question: A Go-Back-N windowed protocol does not require an increase in complexity compared to Stop-And-Wait in relation to

options.A: Amount of memory required by the transmitter
options.B: Minimum amount of sequence numbers required to distinguish data units
options.C: Amount of memory required at the receiver

correct_answer_content: Amount of memory required at the receiver
hint: The Go-Back-N does not require an increase in complexity compared to the receiver window of Stop-And-Wait.

question: The Aloha and S-Aloha protocols

options.A: To avoid interference between transmissions of users sharing a broadcast channel, assign each user a predetermined time interval in which to transmit
options.B: Do not implement any preventive control to avoid interference between transmissions of users sharing a broadcast channel; only in case of interference (collision) do they intervene, repeating transmission after a fixed delay
options.C: Do not implement any preventive control to avoid interference between transmissions of users sharing a broadcast channel; only in case of interference (collision) do they intervene, repeating transmission after a random delay

correct_answer_content: Do not implement any preventive control to avoid interference between transmissions of users sharing a broadcast channel; only in case of interference (collision) do they intervene, repeating transmission after a random delay
hint: Aloha has low efficiency because nodes transmit without coordination. Collisions trigger random backoff.

question: The architecture of the Internet protocols is organized

options.A: In seven levels
options.B: In four levels
options.C: In six levels
options.D: In a completely non-layered way

correct_answer_content: In four levels
hint: Review Network Architecture & OSI Model concepts.

question: The TCP receiver

options.A: Send cumulative acknowledgments (ACKs)
options.B: Sends an acknowledgment (ACK) for each segment
options.C: Does not send feedback

correct_answer_content: Send cumulative acknowledgments (ACKs)
hint: TCP uses window protocols with cumulative ACKs.

question: The header of the TCP segment

options.A: Always fixed size of 20 bytes
options.B: Variable size depending on options
options.C: Fixed size of 40 bytes

correct_answer_content: Variable size depending on options
hint: TCP header contains an options field of variable size. See slides "TCP".

question: The logical addresses on the Internet are

options.A: Determinants free from subnet admins
options.B: Organized in domains
options.C: Completely free format

correct_answer_content: Organized in domains
hint: See slides on IP.

question: The routing protocol can be used between ASs (Autonomous Systems)

options.A: EGP (Exterior Gateway Protocol)
options.B: RIP (Routing Information Protocol)
options.C: OSPF (Open Shortest Path First)

correct_answer_content: EGP (Exterior Gateway Protocol)
hint: Routers of different AS exchange information via EGP.

question: In the OSI model, a (N)-connection

options.A: Can be realized through one or more (N-1) connections
options.B: Terminated by two (N-1)-CEPs
options.C: Realized through one or more (N+1)-connections
options.D: Only through multiple (N-1) connections

correct_answer_content: Can be realized through one or more (N-1) connections
hint: By definition, (N) layer provides services to (N+1) layer.

question: Compared to the 10 Mbit/s Ethernet standard, 100 Mbit/s Ethernet MAC protocol

options.A: Modified for more efficient collision detection
options.B: Modified to avoid collisions, improve performance, support real-time
options.C: Unchanged, accepts reduction of “collision domain”
options.D: Unchanged, maximum size unchanged

correct_answer_content: Unchanged, accepts reduction of “collision domain”
hint: See slides on MAC.

question: The metric (cost) in a routing algorithm

options.A: Expresses the weight of a link in path selection
options.B: Expresses computational complexity
options.C: Expresses probability shortest path used

correct_answer_content: Expresses the weight of a link in path selection
hint: See slides.

question: Advantages of virtual circuit services over datagram services

options.A: Less packet delay, routing calculation for each packet
options.B: Less variability of delays, maintain sequence, routing for each packet
options.C: Less variability of delays, maintain sequence, routing only when opening connection

correct_answer_content: Less variability of delays, maintain sequence, routing only when opening connection
hint: Virtual circuit maintains sequence, less delay variation, routing only at connection open.

question: IEEE 802.1d Transparent Bridges

options.A: Routing follows "backward learning" and flooding
options.B: Routing based on exchange of routing tables
options.C: Routing always occurs in flooding mode

correct_answer_content: Routing follows "backward learning" and flooding
hint: Internet source.

question: Compared to Fast Ethernet at 100 Mb/s, 1 Gb/s Ethernet respects collision recognition

options.A: Decreasing distance between nodes
options.B: Using optical fiber
options.C: Increasing minimum size of PDUs

correct_answer_content: Increasing minimum size of PDUs
hint: Larger PDUs required to maintain Transmission > RTT.

question: Compared to CBR, VBR sources

options.A: Greater difference between max and min transmission speed
options.B: More stringent max delay requirements
options.C: More stringent average delay requirements

correct_answer_content: Greater difference between max and min transmission speed
hint: VBR used for streaming; CBR for videoconferencing.

question: End-to-end error recovery in Internet environment, when present:

options.A: Is always performed only by application processes
options.B: Is performed at the Transport layer
options.C: Is performed at the Internet (network) layer
options.D: Is not provided for any type of service

correct_answer_content: Is performed at the Transport layer
hint: End-to-end principle applies at transport layer for TCP/UDP.

question: The POP3 protocol

options.A: Used for blocking pop-ups
options.B: Used for email exchange between servers
options.C: Used to transfer email from server to client
options.D: Uses encrypted authentication

correct_answer_content: Used to transfer email from server to client
hint: POP3 is client-server protocol for email access.

question: Collision domain in Ethernet

options.A: Portion of network where same collision is detected
options.B: Number of bits in packet header damaged by collision
options.C: Set of nodes interrupting transmission due to collision

correct_answer_content: Portion of network where same collision is detected
hint: See slides “Domain of collision”.

question: In an IP subnet

options.A: Hosts share same network prefix
options.B: Network prefix is first 3 bytes of address

correct_answer_content: Hosts share same network prefix
hint: All subnets must share the same network address.

question: OSI reference model: (N)-PCI can contain

options.A: (N)-addresses
options.B: (N+1)-addresses
options.C: (N-1)-addresses

correct_answer_content: (N)-addresses
hint: N-level header contains N addresses; N-SDU contains (N+1) addresses.

question: The TCP protocol

options.A: Provides error detection on data of each segment through a checksum
options.B: Provides error detection only on the segment header
options.C: Does not provide error detection and recovery on data

correct_answer_content: Provides error detection on data of each segment through a checksum
hint: TCP offers checksum on received packets.

question: P/F bit in LAPB

options.A: Implicit confirmation
options.B: Request confirmation from receiver
options.C: Speeds up transmission

correct_answer_content: Request confirmation from receiver
hint: Poll/Final field single bit: Poll for request, Final for response.

question: Protocols not performing data unit delimitation

options.A: LAPB (ISDN B channel)
options.B: LaPF (Frame Relay)
options.C: PPP
options.D: IEEE 802.2 LLC

correct_answer_content: IEEE 802.2 LLC
hint: Delimiters inserted by MAC protocol.

question: Ethernet full-duplex mode requires

options.A: The ability to receive and transmit packets simultaneously
options.B: The availability of fault protection techniques through two disjoint paths between each pair of nodes
options.C: Full support for both 10 Mbit/s and 100 Mbit/s speeds

correct_answer_content: The ability to receive and transmit packets simultaneously
hint: Full-duplex uses separate cables for TX/RX.

question: Tree topology characteristics

options.A: Low channels, bad fault tolerance, easy routing
options.B: Low channels, good fault tolerance, easy routing
options.C: High channels, good fault tolerance, difficult routing

correct_answer_content: Low channels, bad fault tolerance, easy routing
hint: See slides "Tree topology".

question: IPv4 addresses are:

options.A: Of fixed total length, composed of a variable-length part that identifies the network and a variable-length part that identifies the host
options.B: Of fixed total length, composed of a fixed-length part that identifies the network and a fixed-length part tha tidentifies the host
options.C: Of variable length, composed of a variable-length part that identifies the network and a variable-length part that identifies the host

correct_answer_content: Of fixed total length, composed of a variable-length part that identifies the network and a variable-length part that identifies the host
hint: IPV4 definition.

question: Store-and-forward large PDUs

options.A: Decreases probability of bit errors
options.B: Minimizes transfer delay
options.C: Requires larger header
options.D: Increases overall transfer delay

correct_answer_content: Increases overall transfer delay
hint: Large packets delay transmission; small packets preferred.

question: Selective Repeat protocol Wt/Wr

options.A: Works only if Wt + Wr <= 2^k
options.B: Only if Wt <= 2^k
options.C: Only if Wr <= 2^k

correct_answer_content: Works only if Wt + Wr <= 2^k
hint: See “Selective Repeat” slides.

question: Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP)

options.A: Go-Back-N for loss recovery
options.B: Use address field to distinguish commands
options.C: Uses 01111110 sequence to delimit data

correct_answer_content: Uses 01111110 sequence to delimit data
hint: See slides “Encapsulating PPP PDUs”.

question: Store-and-forward advantages

options.A: Different speeds between channels on same switch
options.B: Reduce delays through switching node
options.C: Reduce packet header size
options.D: Use Forward Error Correction

correct_answer_content: Different speeds between channels on same switch
hint: Ability to adapt to channels with different capacities.

question: The difference between teleservices, bearer services and supplementary services lies in the fact that:

options.A: While bearer services offer only information transfer between user-network interfaces, teleservices involve user equipment functions according to predetermined protocols; supplementary services instead modify or integrate a bearer service and a teleservice
options.B: While teleservices offer only information transfer between user-network interfaces, bearer services involve user equipment functions according to predetermined protocols; supplementary services are special services for data transfer
options.C: While bearer services offer only information transfer between user-network interfaces, teleservices involve user equipment functions according to predetermined protocols; supplementary services are special services for data transfer

correct_answer_content: While bearer services offer only information transfer between user-network interfaces, teleservices involve user equipment functions according to predetermined protocols; supplementary services instead modify or integrate a bearer service and a teleservice
hint: Bearer services are essential; teleservices rely on them.

question: OSI model functions in telecom network

options.A: Operations on service interface
options.B: Rules between entities in same layer
options.C: Operations within architectural layer

correct_answer_content: Operations within architectural layer
hint: B defines protocol.

question: Consider a transmitting host that uses the TCP protocol and a receiver at infinite speed, i.e., that always declares the maximum available value as the reception window. Given a current window at the transmitter of size equal to 10 segments, with a maximum receiver window equal to 20 segments, at the moment when the transmitter receives a segment containing an ACK from the receiver, which of the following situations is possible?

options.A: Current window becomes 3 segments
options.B: Current window becomes 51 segments
options.C: Current window becomes 11 segments
options.D: Current window becomes 13 segments

correct_answer_content: Current window becomes 11 segments
hint: Slow-start, cwnd increases +1 segment per ACK.

question: Domain Name System (DNS)

options.A: Assign Ethernet address from IP
options.B: Map (3)-addresses to (2)-addresses
options.C: Know IP of logical name website
options.D: Know physical location of host

correct_answer_content: Know IP of logical name website
hint: DNS maps logical names to IP addresses.

question: Given a number of nodes and a number of channels, a topology T1 for which the average distance between nodes is smaller than another topology T2, in the presence of uniformly distributed traffic:

options.A: Allows handling the same amount of traffic on the channels
options.B: Allows handling a lower amount of traffic on the channels
options.C: Allows handling a greater amount of traffic on the channels

correct_answer_content: Allows handling a greater amount of traffic on the channels
hint: Throughput inversely proportional to average distance.

question: The piggybacking technique in window protocols consists in the possibility of:

options.A: Sending back to the transmitter any data units that have suffered transmission errors
options.B: Concatenating multiple acknowledgments in a data unit
options.C: Carrying acknowledgment information and user data in the same data unit
options.D: Having the receiver explicitly signal to the transmitter any data unit losses

correct_answer_content: Carrying acknowledgment information and user data in the same data unit
hint: Piggybacking allows ACK info in opposite-direction PDU.

question: Distinguishing commands and responses in layer 2 LaPB protocol frames has the purpose of:

options.A: Understanding whether a Poll bit or a Final bit was sent
options.B: Understanding who is the recipient of the frame
options.C: Distinguishing supervision frames from information frames

correct_answer_content: Distinguishing supervision frames from information frames
hint: LAPB frame: supervision field for control only.

question: LAN bus topology CSMA

options.A: Time detection greater at ends, less at center
options.B: Same for all nodes
options.C: Depends on position relative to transmitters

correct_answer_content: Depends on position relative to transmitters
hint: See slides "CSMA".

question: Header of packet in datagram service

options.A: Source & destination addresses
options.B: Destination + connection ID
options.C: Connection ID
options.D: Source + connection ID

correct_answer_content: Source & destination addresses
hint: See slides “IP datagram format”.

question: Compared to the 10 Mbit/s Ethernet standard, in the definition of 100 Mbit/s Ethernet, the MAC protocol

options.A: Has been modified by introducing a collision avoidance mechanism, which allows improving performance and supporting real-time services
options.B: Has been kept unchanged, accepting the reduction by a factor of ten (approximately) of the maximum size of the "collision domain"
options.C: Has been kept unchanged, maintaining the maximum size of the "collision domain" unchanged, but increasing the minimum frame size by a factor of ten
options.D: Has been modified to allow more efficient collision detection

correct_answer_content: Has been kept unchanged, accepting the reduction by a factor of ten (approximately) of the maximum size of the "collision domain"
hint: See transparencies.

question: PPP duplicate quiz

options.A: Makes use of a go-back-n window protocol for recovery of data unit losses
options.B: Makes use of the address field in data units to distinguish those sent by the user from those sent by the operator
options.C: Makes use of a known bit sequence to delimit data units

correct_answer_content: Makes use of a known bit sequence to delimit data units
hint: See transparencies “Encapsulating PPP PDUs”.

question: IP router after calculating route

options.A: Change source & destination IP
options.B: Edit TTL & checksum
options.C: Edit TTL only

correct_answer_content: Edit TTL & checksum
hint: TTL changes require checksum update.

question: An Ethernet card in a switch processes (that is, it reads and decides whether and how to route)

options.A: Only packets with broadcast destination MAC address
options.B: All packets, regardless of the destination address
options.C: Only packets with unicast destination MAC address equal to that of the switch
options.D: Only packets with multicast destination MAC address

correct_answer_content: All packets, regardless of the destination address
hint: See switch operation.

question: Which of the following statements is true? A host connected to the Internet, at the moment when it wants to transmit/receive data to/from any other host on the Internet network, must know. where he wants to transmit / receive data to / from any other host on the Internet, he must know

options.A: Its own IP address and related mask, its own MAC address, the IP address of the default router, the IP address of a DNS
options.B: Only its own MAC address
options.C: Only its own IP address

correct_answer_content: Its own IP address and related mask, its own MAC address, the IP address of the default router, the IP address of a DNS
hint: Fonte Marchetto.

question: By commutation we mean

options.A: The exchange of information concerning the control and management of a telecommunications network
options.B: The transfer of information from one point to one or more other points
options.C: The process of interconnecting resources for the time necessary for communication

correct_answer_content: The process of interconnecting resources for the time necessary for communication
hint: See transparencies “Function: switching”. The C represents the 7 circuit switching! There control information.

question: In the OSI model, the transport layer provides services

options.A: Building on services from the application layer
options.B: Relying on the services provided by the network layer
options.C: Relying on the services provided by the session level

correct_answer_content: Relying on the services provided by the network layer
hint: Review Transport Layer concepts.

question: In the OSI model, the network layer provides services

options.A: Building on the services provided by the application layer
options.B: Based on the services provided by the transport layer
options.C: Relying on the services provided by the link layer

correct_answer_content: Relying on the services provided by the link layer
hint: The network layer is above the connection layer.

question: In a real mobile radio channel, the fading phenomenon consists in:

options.A: Decrease in received power, caused by the distance between transmitter and receiver
options.B: Rapid variation of the received power, caused by sources operating at the same frequency
options.C: Reduction of the received power, caused by atmospheric sources such as rain and snow
options.D: Rapid variation of the received power, caused by the presence of moving obstacles

correct_answer_content: Rapid variation of the received power, caused by the presence of moving obstacles
hint: See slides “Real (mobile) radio channel”.

question: In the IP header, or in the PCI of the IP protocol, they are mandatory contents:

options.A: The IP address of a source and destination
options.B: The port of a source and destination
options.C: The Window field that allows the receiver to report the current size of the window reception to the transmitter

correct_answer_content: The IP address of a source and destination
hint: See slides “IP datagram format”.

question: The IP protocol:

options.A: Guarantees error detection only on the datagram header
options.B: Guarantees error detection on the header and the content of the datagram
options.C: It does not provide any kind of error protection
options.D: Guarantees error detection only on the content of the datagram

correct_answer_content: Guarantees error detection only on the datagram header
hint: The Header Checksum field (16 bits) is used to verify that the IP header has arrived intact at destination. It only checks the integrity of the header.

question: The Go-Back-N protocol is more complex than the Stop-And-Wait protocol due

options.A: The greater complexity of the transmitter
options.B: The greater complexity of the receiver
options.C: The greater complexity of both the receiver and the transmitter

correct_answer_content: The greater complexity of the transmitter
hint: Complexity at the receiver is nearly the same; the transmitter is more complex due to window >1.

question: The use of cookies in the HTTP protocol allows you to

options.A: Associate multiple requests made by the same browser or user
options.B: Cache the responses received
options.C: Download all the objects contained in a page by opening a single TCP connection
options.D: Send the response to the client using different fragments (Chunked Transfer)

correct_answer_content: Associate multiple requests made by the same browser or user
hint: See slides "cookies".

question: In a fully connected mesh topology with N nodes, the number of channels bidirectional is equal to

options.B: 2N
options.D: No.

hint: See slides “Knitted topology”.

question: The IP protocol provides a service

options.A: Unreliable (i.e. no delivery guarantee) and connectionless
options.B: Reliable (i.e. with delivery guarantee) and connectionless
options.C: Unreliable (i.e. without delivery guarantee) and connection oriented

correct_answer_content: Unreliable (i.e. no delivery guarantee) and connectionless
hint: IP is connectionless and best-effort; no guarantees.

question: Compared to the IP protocol, the UDP protocol

options.A: It adds nothing
options.B: Adds the ability to carry messages by distinguishing between different application processes on the same host
options.C: It allows a reliable transport of information

correct_answer_content: Adds the ability to carry messages by distinguishing between different application processes on the same host
hint: UDP is unreliable; it provides multiplexing and demultiplexing.

question: Which of the following line encodings is more efficient, i.e., requires physically lower bit rate at the same rate of information transmitted?

options.A: 4B5B encoding
options.B: 64B66B encoding
options.C: 8B10B encoding

correct_answer_content: 64B66B encoding
hint: 64B66B requires a minimal increase in physical bit rate (1.03×) versus 1.25× for 4B5B or 8B10B.

question: The CIDR (Classless Inter Domain Routing), based on the use of netmasks in IP, is a technique used in order to

options.A: Decrease the convergence time of routing protocols
options.B: Efficiently use the IP addressing space
options.C: Avoid the formation of routing loops in routing

correct_answer_content: Efficiently use the IP addressing space
hint: See transparencies.

question: The DSL access network separates data and voice on the same transmission medium between the devices user and control panel devices using:

options.A: Time multiplexing
options.B: Multiple access to frequency division
options.C: Multiple access to time division
options.D: Frequency multiplexing

correct_answer_content: Frequency multiplexing
hint: ADSL uses frequency division with filters at user and central side.

question: The Stop-And-Wait protocol

options.A: It can only work using more than one numbering bit
options.B: It can work using a number of numbering bits greater than or equal to 1
options.C: It can only work using a single numbering bit
options.D: It can only work using fewer numbering bits than the window size transmission

correct_answer_content: It can work using a number of numbering bits greater than or equal to 1
hint: Using ≥1 bit reduces malfunctions and allows PDU/ACK tracking.

question: In a tree topology with N nodes, the number of bidirectional channels is equal to

options.A: N
options.C: 2N

hint: See slides “Tree Topology”.

question: In the UDP header, or in the PCI of the UDP protocol, are mandatory contents

options.A: The value of the Maximum Segment Size negotiated between transmitter and receiver
options.B: The checksum field, for error detection
options.C: Some flags (in the CODE field) for opening and closing the connection

correct_answer_content: The checksum field, for error detection
hint: UDP provides multiplexing and checksum error checking.

question: The transport layer on the Internet

options.A: Provides reliable information transport if UDP protocol is used
options.B: It only provides unreliable transportation
options.C: Always provides reliable information transport
options.D: Provides reliable information transport if using the TCP protocol

correct_answer_content: Provides reliable information transport if using the TCP protocol
hint: TCP provides reliable transport; UDP does not.

question: In a routing table of an IP router there is a mask in which the first 24 bits (the most significant) are 1 and the last 8 bits (the least significant) are 0. Which of the following statements is true?

options.A: The mask can be associated with a "subneted" class B address
options.B: The mask is definitely associated with a "subneted" class A address
options.C: The mask cannot be associated with a class C address

correct_answer_content: The mask can be associated with a "subneted" class B address
hint: This mask can be used for a subneted class B address.

question: A Go-Back-N protocol with a transmission window of size Wt

options.A: It can only work using a number of numbering bits greater than or equal to log2(Wt)
options.B: It can only work using a number of numbering bits greater than or equal to log2(Wt-1)
options.C: It can only work using a number of numbering bits greater than or equal to log2(Wt + 1)

correct_answer_content: It can only work using a number of numbering bits greater than or equal to log2(Wt + 1)
hint: Go-Back-N allows Wt <= 2^k-1, so k ≥ log2(Wt+1).

question: ADSL (Asymmetric Digital Subscriber Line) technology

options.A: It was mainly designed to provide a voice / data access service to a residential user mainly accessing the Web as a client
options.B: It was mainly designed to allow interconnection of local networks over large distances
options.C: It has been designed primarily to provide a purely data access service to web servers

correct_answer_content: It was mainly designed to provide a voice / data access service to a residential user mainly accessing the Web as a client
hint: See transparencies “ADSL”.

question: The quality characteristics required by a telephony service are:

options.A: Transfer of information with a maximum delay of the order of hundreds of milliseconds and extremely low jitter; bit rate of the order of tens of kbit/s; probability of error not more than a few percent; probability of block not exceeding a few percent
options.B: Transfer of information with a maximum delay of the order of tens of seconds; negligible error and block probability
options.C: Transfer of information with a maximum delay of hundreds of milliseconds; bit rate of tens of Mbit/s; low error

correct_answer_content: Transfer of information with a maximum delay of the order of hundreds of milliseconds and extremely low jitter; bit rate of the order of tens of kbit/s; probability of error not more than a few percent; probability of block not exceeding a few percent
hint: See slides "Quality indices (telephony)".

question: In the original IP routing, i.e., without the use of masks, the choice of the output interface on which to forward a packet is based

options.A: The full IP address subnet(net_id + host_id) of the recipient
options.B: On the network part subnet(net_id) of the recipient's IP address
options.C: Only on the host subnet(host_id) part of the recipient's IP address

correct_answer_content: On the network part subnet(net_id) of the recipient's IP address
hint: Forwarding is based on net_id only.

question: The DNS (Domain Name Service):

options.A: To increase reliability and responsiveness uses caches, but each resolution must reach authoritative server
options.B: Used by operators for sale of domain names
options.C: Based on hierarchical servers, each responsible for a zone
options.D: Product to distribute load on routers

correct_answer_content: Based on hierarchical servers, each responsible for a zone
hint: DNS resolves host names using distributed hierarchical servers.

question: Which of the following statements in the comparison between the Aloha and Slotted-Aloha protocols is false?

options.A: Slotted-Aloha allows a better exploitation of the capacity of the transmission medium
options.B: The performance of Aloha is less dependent than Slotted-Aloha on propagation delays
options.C: Aloha is simpler to implement by not requiring slot synchronization

correct_answer_content: The performance of Aloha is less dependent than Slotted-Aloha on propagation delays
hint: Slotted-Aloha reduces partial collisions; Aloha simpler but more affected by delays.

question: In the case of packet switching

options.A: The switching function allocates to the interlocutors a subset of network resources with which one or more circuits are established for connecting user terminals; the resources must be released if they are needed for establishing other circuits
options.B: The switching function allocates to the interlocutors in exclusive use a subset of network resources with which one or more circuits are established for connecting user terminals; the resources are released only at the end of communication
options.C: The switching function does not allocate to the interlocutors in exclusive use a subset of network resources; all network resources are always available for packet transmission; packets wait in appropriate queues until the necessary resources become available

correct_answer_content: The switching function does not allocate to the interlocutors in exclusive use a subset of network resources; all network resources are always available for packet transmission; packets wait in appropriate queues until the necessary resources become available
hint: See transparencies “Packet switching”.

question: In the header (header) UDP, or in the PCI of the UDP protocol are mandatory contents

options.A: The TTL (Time To Live) field
options.B: The source and destination port
options.C: The source and destination IP address

correct_answer_content: The source and destination port
hint: See transparencies “UDP: segment header”.

question: Internet routing tables

options.A: They indicate the sequence of routers to cross to reach a destination
options.B: They only indicate the next router to cross to reach the destination
options.C: They indicate the autonomous system sequence

correct_answer_content: They only indicate the next router to cross to reach the destination
hint: See sheets “IP routing (next hop)”.

question: Data transfer between two application processes in the OSI model occurs by involving

options.A: Only two entities of the application layer, one per system
options.B: At least one entity for each of the seven levels in both systems
options.C: An entity in each system, independent of the level

correct_answer_content: At least one entity for each of the seven levels in both systems
hint: Transmitter passes all layers down; receiver goes up all layers.

question: Consider two Ethernet LANs A and B, connected by a switch B1 and a router R1 (B1 and R1 are in parallel between the two LANs). Suppose that both the switch and router have all ports active and know all addresses (MAC and IP respectively) of hosts connected to the two LANs. When a host connected to LAN A transmits an ARP packet to obtain the MAC address of router R1, which of the following statements is true?

options.A: Forwarded on LAN B only by router R1
options.B: Forwarded on LAN B only by switch B1
options.C: The packet is forwarded on LAN B either by the switch or by the router, depending on the value of the destination MAC address contained in the packet
options.D: The packet is forwarded on LAN B by both router R1 and switch B1

correct_answer_content: Forwarded on LAN B only by switch B1
hint: Switch forwards broadcast to all ports; router responds only if target.

question: The SMTP protocol

options.A: Operates on the UDP protocol, since email messages are usually short
options.B: Is based on messages that always include encrypted authentication
options.C: Is used for delivering outgoing email messages from a client to a given server
options.D: Is used to transfer email messages from a server to a client installed on a PC

correct_answer_content: Is used for delivering outgoing email messages from a client to a given server
hint: SMTP sends messages from client to mail server.

question: Using Stop-And-Wait on a non-sequential channel

options.A: Always handled without problems
options.B: Can cause protocol malfunctions and algorithm blocking
options.C: Can cause malfunctions but not blocking

correct_answer_content: Can cause protocol malfunctions and algorithm blocking
hint: With k=1, examples of blocking and information loss.

question: An (N-1)-protocol allows interaction

options.A: Between (N+1) and (N-1)-entity
options.B: Between two (N-1)-entities
options.C: Between any two entities at different levels
options.D: Between two (N)-entities

correct_answer_content: Between two (N-1)-entities
hint: Protocols work between same-layer entities.

question: In the case of circuit switching:

options.A: The switching function allocates to the interlocutors a subset of network resources with which one or more circuits are established for connecting user terminals; the resources must be released if they are needed for establishing other circuits
options.B: The switching function allocates to the interlocutors in exclusive use a subset of network resources with which one or more circuits are established for connecting user terminals; the resources are released only at the end of communication
options.C: The switching function does not allocate to the interlocutors in exclusive use a subset of network resources; all network resources are always available for packet transmission; packets wait in appropriate queues until the necessary resources become available

correct_answer_content: The switching function allocates to the interlocutors in exclusive use a subset of network resources with which one or more circuits are established for connecting user terminals; the resources are released only at the end of communication
hint: See transparencies “Switching to circuit”.

question: Version 4 IP addresses of class C characterize:

options.A: Multicast communications
options.B: Few networks with many hosts
options.C: Many networks with a small number of hosts

correct_answer_content: Many networks with a small number of hosts
hint: Class C addresses: many networks, few hosts.

question: The CSMA and CSMA-CD protocols

options.A: Try to avoid interference between transmissions of users sharing a broadcast channel through preventive listening to the channel state; transmission can begin only if the channel is heard free
options.B: Do not implement any preventive control to avoid interference between transmissions of users sharing a broadcast channel; only in case of interference (collision) is action taken, repeating the transmission after a random delay
options.C: Try to avoid interference between transmissions of users sharing a broadcast channel through preventive listening to the channel state; transmission can begin only if the channel is actually free

correct_answer_content: Try to avoid interference between transmissions of users sharing a broadcast channel through preventive listening to the channel state; transmission can begin only if the channel is heard free
hint: Preventive listening reduces collisions.

question: By signaling is meant

options.A: The transfer of information from one point to one or more other points
options.B: The exchange of information concerning the control of a telecommunications network

correct_answer_content: The exchange of information concerning the control of a telecommunications network
hint: Reporting refers to signaling/control exchange.

question: The MIME protocol allows

options.A: To have data encoded differently within the e-mail message
options.B: To reserve the resources on the network so that an email message with a multimedia file attached can reach the destination with guaranteed quality
options.C: To transmit useful information to the recipients of the e-mail to monitor the quality of the transmission
options.D: Check the playback of a multimedia file downloaded from the network

correct_answer_content: To have data encoded differently within the e-mail message
hint: See slides “Message format: multimedia extensions”.

question: Statistical multiplexing means

options.A: A fixed frequency multiplexing scheme in which the band assigned to the different information flows it is proportional to the transmission speed
options.B: A multiplexing scheme that provides for a random choice between frequency multiplexing and multiplexing over time
options.C: A multiplexing scheme that does not foresee a predetermined allocation of resources transmissive to information flows

correct_answer_content: A multiplexing scheme that does not foresee a predetermined allocation of resources transmissive to information flows
hint: The C corresponds to the definition of statistical multiplexing.

question: What is the order of magnitude of the maximum transmission speed on an optical fiber?

options.A: 1 Tbit / s
options.B: 1 kbit / s
options.C: 1 Mbit / s
options.D: 1 Gbit / s

correct_answer_content: 1 Tbit / s
hint: See transparencies “The optical fiber”.

question: If a router receives a correct TCP packet, encapsulated in an IP packet with header destined for a non-existent TCP port (for which no application process is waiting):

options.A: Discard it and send an ICMP packet to the destination
options.B: Pass it to a default application process that handles all TCP packets for which no there is an application process available
options.C: Ignore the TCP port value and send the packet
options.D: Discard it and send an ICMP packet to the source

correct_answer_content: Ignore the TCP port value and send the packet
hint: Since the TCP packet is encapsulated in an IP packet, the latter will not be able to detect the TCP port error, so the correct answer is C.

question: The increment of the current window of the TCP transmitter

options.A: It is regulated only by the receiver
options.B: It is regulated only by the slow-start congestion control phase
options.C: It is regulated by the congestion control phase called slow-start and congestion avoidance

correct_answer_content: It is regulated by the congestion control phase called slow-start and congestion avoidance
hint: See “TCP congestion control” slides.

question: The CSMA and CSMA-CD protocols admit 1-persistent and non-persistent versions

options.A: In the case of the 1-persistent version, if listening to the channel indicates that it is busy, the attempt is proposed for a random delay; in the case of non-persistent versions, if listening to the channel indicates that it is busy, the transmission starts as soon as the current transmission ends
options.B: In the case of the non-persistent version, if listening to the channel indicates that it is busy, the attempt is proposed for a random delay; in the case of 1-persistent versions, if listening to the channel indicates that it is busy, the transmission begins as soon as the current transmission ends
options.C: In both cases, if listening to the channel indicates that it is busy, the transmission attempt it is postponed with a random delay

correct_answer_content: In the case of the non-persistent version, if listening to the channel indicates that it is busy, the attempt is proposed for a random delay; in the case of 1-persistent versions, if listening to the channel indicates that it is busy, the transmission begins as soon as the current transmission ends
hint: See slides "CSMA".

question: Suppose that between a transmitter and a receiver they implement an ARQ scheme (Automatic repeat request) of the Go-Back-N type the time that elapses between the start of the transmission of a data unit and the end of receipt of the corresponding acknowledgment is constant and greater than the time necessary to transmit the information that can be stored in the transmission window. In this situation, the increase of the transmission speed on the channels that connect the transmitter to the receiver

options.A: It decreases the amount of information transferred on average in the unit of time between the transmitter and the receiver
options.B: It fails to increase the amount of information transferred on average in the unit of time between transmitter and receiver
options.C: Increases the amount of information transferred on average in the unit of time between the transmitter and the receiver

correct_answer_content: Increases the amount of information transferred on average in the unit of time between the transmitter and the receiver
hint: n = Wt / (1 + 2 (Tp / Tx)) => at higher speeds, Tx decreases and n (efficiency) increases.

question: In the OSI model, the delimitation of frames, ie the ability to identify on a channel the end of a packet, is a function:

options.A: Performed by all OSI levels
options.B: Typical of the level or sub-level adjacent to the physical level
options.C: Exclusive to the network level

correct_answer_content: Typical of the level or sub-level adjacent to the physical level
hint: Level 2 takes care of this.

question: In the event of a loss of segments identified by receiving three hits, the current window size of the reno TCP transmitter

options.A: It is brought to half the size of the receiver window
options.B: It is brought back to the initial value, equal to one segment
options.C: It is placed in the middle of the current value (to be precise, in half of the current value plus a segment)

correct_answer_content: It is placed in the middle of the current value (to be precise, in half of the current value plus a segment)
hint: This is how TCP reno works.

question: Frame Relay technology predicts

options.A: The transfer of fixed-size data units in non-connection-oriented mode
options.B: The transfer of data units of fixed size on virtual circuits
options.C: The transfer of data units of variable size on virtual circuits

correct_answer_content: The transfer of data units of variable size on virtual circuits
hint: See “Frame Relay” slides.

question: The Network Address Translation (NAT) Mechanism

options.A: Realizes in OSI terms a mapping function
options.B: Can modify the IP addresses of the packets
options.C: Allows you to set the logical address of a host to the IP address

correct_answer_content: Can modify the IP addresses of the packets
hint: See slides "NAT".

question: In the absence of other packets, the minimum time it takes for a packet to traverse the switch operating in store-and-forward mode

options.A: It grows as the packet transmission speed increases
options.B: It grows as the distance between the source and destination of the packet increases
options.C: It grows as the number of bits of which the packet is composed increases

correct_answer_content: It grows as the number of bits of which the packet is composed increases
hint: See “Store and forward” slides.

question: The PING application program

options.A: It uses ICMP protocol messages to determine the path followed to reach a host belonging to the internet
options.B: Use a TCP protocol option to check the connectivity of a host belonging to the network Internet
options.C: It uses ICMP protocol messages to check the connectivity of a host belonging to the network Internet

correct_answer_content: It uses ICMP protocol messages to check the connectivity of a host belonging to the network Internet
hint: See transparencies of the “PING” command.

question: A network topology with N nodes and M unidirectional channels is given. Each channel has capabilities C Mbit / s. The routing algorithm is such as to evenly distribute traffic over the network channels. The average number of channels traversed by a packet in the path from the source to the destination is equal to D. The maximum amount of traffic disposed of by the network increases if:

options.A: Decreases C to equal N, M and D.
options.B: Decreases M to equal N, D and C
options.C: Decreases D to equal N, M and C
options.D: Decreases N to equal D, M and C

correct_answer_content: Decreases D to equal N, M and C
hint: if the average distance decreases, with the same channel capacity, the traffic disposed of should increase.

question: Statistical multiplexing

options.A: Can only be used in connectionless networks
options.B: It is used in telephone networks because it is closely associated with the use of constant speed channels
options.C: It consists in sharing the same resource (transmission channel, memory device, etc.) by traffic sources that use it on an instantaneous need
options.D: Can only be used in connection oriented networks, but not circuit switched

correct_answer_content: It consists in sharing the same resource (transmission channel, memory device, etc.) by traffic sources that use it on an instantaneous need
hint: By definition in statistical multiplexing the same resource can be used in frequency or in time to multiple sources.

question: In a packet-switched network operating in store-and-forward mode, a larger data unit size

options.A: The routing complexity of each data unit increases
options.B: Increases the time that elapses from when a data unit reaches the input of a switch a when this leaves the switch
options.C: Increase the number of operations that must be performed by a switch to transfer the same total amount of user information

correct_answer_content: Increases the time that elapses from when a data unit reaches the input of a switch a when this leaves the switch
hint: Long packets lead to a longer store time by the receiving node.

question: Congestion control in the TCP protocol

options.A: It is not available
options.B: It is based on an autonomous decision by the transmitter based on any feedback (ACK) duplicates and on the expiry of the time-out
options.C: It is based on the signaling by the receiver of the available reception window

correct_answer_content: It is based on an autonomous decision by the transmitter based on any feedback (ACK) duplicates and on the expiry of the time-out
hint: Per il controllo della congestione la CWND aumenta di 1 MSS per ogni ACK ricevuto finché non avviene un timeout.

question: Window protocols are also called ARQ (Automatic Retransmission reQuest) because

options.A: In case of arrival of an incorrect packet, the receiver requests retransmission
options.B: If an ACK fails to return, the receiver requests retransmission
options.C: The expiration of the timeout at the transmitter corresponds to an automatic request for retransmission

correct_answer_content: The expiration of the timeout at the transmitter corresponds to an automatic request for retransmission
hint: see window protocols slide.

question: In the case of common channel signaling

options.A: A signaling channel corresponds to each channel for the transfer of user information
options.B: A single signaling channel is used to control several transfer channels user information; the signaling channel operates in packet mode
options.C: A single signaling channel is used to control several transfer channels user information; the signaling channel operates in circuit mode

correct_answer_content: A single signaling channel is used to control several transfer channels user information; the signaling channel operates in packet mode
hint: In common channel signaling, a single signaling channel operates in packet mode to control several user transfer channels.

question: In the current state of technology, it is possible to transmit information without amplification along the transmission line over greater distances using

options.A: The Hertzian channel (radio, satellite)
options.B: Optical fibers
options.C: The twisted pairs
options.D: Coaxial cables

correct_answer_content: The Hertzian channel (radio, satellite)
hint: Radio/satellite channels allow for very long distances without intermediate amplification compared to physical cables.

question: The (N + 1) -directory function associates

options.A: An (N + 1) -address to an (N) -address
options.B: A (N + 1) -title to an (N) -address
options.C: A (N + 1) -title to an (N + 2) -address

correct_answer_content: A (N + 1) -title to an (N) -address
hint: This follows the OSI naming conventions where titles are mapped to addresses of the layer below.

question: The preamble prepended to IEEE 802.3 (Ethernet) data units is required for

options.A: Allow to keep the network synchronous
options.B: Allow the synchronization of repeaters and receivers encountered on the local network
options.C: Allow repeaters to retransmit data drives at the same rate at which they were received

correct_answer_content: Allow the synchronization of repeaters and receivers encountered on the local network
hint: The preamble provides a bit pattern for receiver clock synchronization.

question: If a router detects an incorrect checksum on an IP packet, and therefore a potential error on the IP addresses contained in the packet, during the routing phase

options.A: Discard it and send an ICMP packet to the source only
options.B: It discards it and sends an ICMP packet to both the source and the destination
options.C: Discards it without reporting it to any other network entity
options.D: It still forwards it to the destination, however sending an ICMP packet to the source for report the error

correct_answer_content: Discards it without reporting it to any other network entity
hint: If the header is corrupted (checksum error), the router cannot trust the source address to send an ICMP, so it just drops the packet.

question: In the OSI model, which of the following functions is performed by session-level entities?

options.A: The routing of the data units in a type that is not completely connected
options.B: The choice of data representation syntax for a work session
options.C: The definition of synchronization points in a data unit stream

correct_answer_content: The definition of synchronization points in a data unit stream
hint: Session layer manages dialogue control and synchronization points.

question: The complexity of the routing procedures used, within a node, for forwarding information has the greatest influence on the performance of a network in the case of

options.A: Packet switching without virtual circuits (datagram mode)
options.B: Packet switching with virtual circuits
options.C: Circuit switching

correct_answer_content: Packet switching without virtual circuits (datagram mode)
hint: In datagram mode, every packet is routed independently, increasing per-packet processing overhead.

question: The LLC SNaP (SubNetwork access Protocol) format of the IEEE 802.2 LLC protocol

options.A: Allows sharing of a broadcast transmission medium
options.B: Allows coexistence of a large number of protocols at levels higher than level
options.C: Is required in Internet for data unit transfer in subnets
options.D: Guarantees the recognition of transmission errors

correct_answer_content: Allows coexistence of a large number of protocols at levels higher than level
hint: SNAP allows multiplexing of various network layer protocols over LLC.

question: In the CSMA and CSMA-CD protocol the concept of "persistence" refers to:

options.A: The way in which the transmission attempt occurs, if listening to the channel indicates that it is busy
options.B: The calculation of the time for which a station is authorized to occupy the channel
options.C: How the retransmission attempt occurs, if a collision has occurred
options.D: The time during which two transmissions overlap on the channel, which is a necessary condition for the collision to be detected

correct_answer_content: The way in which the transmission attempt occurs, if listening to the channel indicates that it is busy
hint: Persistence defines the behavior (wait or retry) when a node senses the medium is busy.

question: In the IP header, or in the PCI of the IP protocol, they are contained:

options.A: The 16-bit Checksum field for checking the correctness of the header and of the data contained in the package
options.B: The Sequence Number field for numbering the segments
options.C: The Identification 3e Fragment Offset fields that allow the management of the fragmentation of packages

correct_answer_content: The Identification 3e Fragment Offset fields that allow the management of the fragmentation of packages
hint: IP header contains fields specifically for fragmentation; checksum only covers the header, not data.

question: Why does VDSL technology have high performance only if the distance between the cab of road and user's home is less than a hundred meters?:

options.A: Because the end-to-end delay between the user's home and the operator's control panel is reduced
options.B: Because the costs of laying cables are reduced
options.C: Because the shorter length of the copper cable allows the use of higher bit rate modulation
options.D: Because the connections have to cross fewer intermediate nodes

correct_answer_content: Because the shorter length of the copper cable allows the use of higher bit rate modulation
hint: High-frequency signals used in VDSL attenuate quickly over copper, requiring short distances.

question: Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) does not use address fields because

options.A: Take advantage of the underlying MAC addresses
options.B: Take advantage of top-level addresses
options.C: It must operate on point-to-point connections
options.D: It has no space in the plot header

correct_answer_content: It must operate on point-to-point connections
hint: In a direct point-to-point link, there is only one possible recipient, so addressing is redundant.

question: The DHCP protocol provides that

options.A: A client uses an IP address as soon as it receives it from the server in a DHCP offer message.
options.B: A client may disconnect from the network without communicating it to the server.
options.C: If a server exists, it is unique on the client's local network.
options.D: The server never also provides the IP address of a DNS server in its response.

correct_answer_content: A client may disconnect from the network without communicating it to the server.
hint: Clients can simply leave; DHCP leases eventually expire if not renewed.

question: The fundamental functions of the link layer in the OSI model are

options.A: Flow control and recovery of transmission errors
options.B: Data drive routing
options.C: Transfer of binary digits on the channel

correct_answer_content: Flow control and recovery of transmission errors
hint: Error detection/recovery and flow control are core Layer 2 functions.

question: During the slow-start phase of the TCP congestion control, the window transmitter current

options.A: It is halved for each missing ACK
options.B: It grows by one segment for each acknowledgment (ACK) received
options.C: Double for each acknowledgment (ACK) received
options.D: It remains constant over time

correct_answer_content: It grows by one segment for each acknowledgment (ACK) received
hint: In slow start, the congestion window increases by 1 MSS for every ACK, effectively doubling every RTT.

question: What is the order of magnitude of the maximum transmission rate on coaxial cable?

options.A: 1 Tbit / s
options.B: 1 Mbit / s
options.C: 1 bit / s
options.D: 1 kbit / s

correct_answer_content: 1 Mbit / s
hint: Standard coaxial typically operates in the range of hundreds of Mbps.

question: Window protocols can be used

options.A: Only for communications that use a connection
options.B: Both for communications that use a connection and for those that don't
options.C: Only for communications that do not use a connection

correct_answer_content: Only for communications that use a connection
hint: Windowing requires state synchronization (sequence numbers/ACKs), typical of connection-oriented services.

question: The Address Resolution Protocol (ARP)

options.A: Obtain an Ethernet address to assign to the machine card it has made the ARP request
options.B: It allows a host to know the IP address of its DNS server
options.C: Realizes in OSI terms a mapping (translation) function between (3)-addresses and (2)-address

correct_answer_content: Realizes in OSI terms a mapping (translation) function between (3)-addresses and (2)-address
hint: ARP maps Layer 3 (IP) addresses to Layer 2 (MAC) addresses.

question: In the OSI model, the segmentation performed by a level entity (N + 1)

options.A: Create many (N + 1)-PDUs from a single (N + 1)-SDU
options.B: Create a (N + 1)-PDU from many (N)-SDUs
options.C: It combines many (N + 1)-PDUs in a single (N)-SDU
options.D: Create many (N + 1)-PCI for the same (N + 1)-PDU

correct_answer_content: Create many (N + 1)-PDUs from a single (N + 1)-SDU
hint: Segmentation breaks down a larger service data unit into multiple protocol data units.

question: Let Wt and Wr be the dimensions, respectively, of the transmission window and of the receive windows in a windowed protocol. Also let N be the total quantity of sequence numbers available to distinguish data drives. Which of the following constraints is a necessary and sufficient condition to avoid malfunctions on a channel that does not reverse the order of the data units?

options.A: N = Wt + 1
options.B: N = (Wt + Wr) / 2
options.C: N = Wr + 1
options.D: N >= Wt + Wr

correct_answer_content: N >= Wt + Wr
hint: The range of sequence numbers must be at least the sum of the sender and receiver windows to prevent overlap issues.

question: The three fundamental elements that define a protocol are:

options.A: Algorithms, formats, timings
options.B: Syntax, semantics, timing
options.C: Algorithms, services, timing
options.D: Algorithms, formats, entities

correct_answer_content: Algorithms, formats, timings
hint: Review Network Architecture & OSI Model concepts.

question: An Ethernet card of a Bridge (ie it reads and decides if and how to route)

options.A: All packets, regardless of the destination address
options.B: Only packets with a unicast destination MAC address equal to that of the bridge
options.C: Packets with broadcast destination MAC address only
options.D: Packets with multicast destination MAC address only

correct_answer_content: All packets, regardless of the destination address
hint: By definition a Bridge's ethernet reads and routes all packets.

question: Which of the following statements is false?

options.A: An IP router can use the Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) to know the MAC address of the router or host to which it is to deliver an IP packet
options.B: A host can use ICMP messages to verify another host's connectivity to the network Internet.
options.C: An IP router, which does not perform a NAT (Network Address Translator) function, does not modify the IP addresses of the packets to be re-transmitted
options.D: An IP host always only makes direct deliveries

correct_answer_content: An IP host always only makes direct deliveries
hint: A, B and C are correct as the ARP definitions are ICMP and NAT. By exclusion the answer is the D.

question: To avoid blocking or loss of data units in a windowed protocol due to channels non-sequential, it is useful

options.A: Number the PDUs on a number of bits greater than 1 and do not limit the life time of the PDUs in the net
options.B: Number the PDUs on a number of bits greater than 1 and limit the life time of the PDUs in the network
options.C: Number the PDUs on a single bit and limit the life time of the PDUs in the network

correct_answer_content: Number the PDUs on a number of bits greater than 1 and limit the life time of the PDUs in the network
hint: By definition, in window protocols, PDUs must be numbered on a number of bits greater than 1. It is necessary that the packets have a minimum life time (Time to Live) otherwise it would lead to congestion of the intermediate nodes.

question: The constraints on the maximum extension of an IEEE 802.3 local network (CSMA / CD) arise

options.A: Both from the propagation delay of the signals from one end of the network to the other, and from the attenuation of the signals on the transmission media.
options.B: Both from the attenuation of the signals on the transmission media and from the maximum delays tolerated by the users MAC service
options.C: By the number of bits that would be needed to increase the data units in the case of large delays propagation

correct_answer_content: Both from the propagation delay of the signals from one end of the network to the other, and from the attenuation of the signals on the transmission media.
hint: Collision detection requires that the transmission time is at least twice the propagation delay.

question: In the case where a windowed protocol is used on a channel that does not allow inversions in the sequence order of transmitted data units (that is on sequential channel), assuming to use a non-cyclic progressive numbering, the transmission and reception windows can never be in the following situation:

options.A: No sequence number included in the receive window is also included in the trasmission windows
options.B: The smallest sequence number in the transmission window is smaller than the smallest sequence number in the receiving window
options.C: The smallest sequence number in the receive window is smaller than the smallest number of sequence in the transmission window.
options.D: The largest sequence number in the receive window is larger than the largest number of sequence in the transmission window

correct_answer_content: The smallest sequence number in the receive window is smaller than the smallest number of sequence in the transmission window.
hint: The send window can advance only after receiving ACKs which must be sent by the receiver after the receiving a packet, but receiving it would necessarily involve a slide forward of the receiver.

question: Medium Access Control (MAC) sublevel protocols serve purpose

options.A: To allow the sharing of a broadcast channel by means of a distributed algorithm
options.B: To allow the sharing of a broadcast channel through a centralized algorithm
options.C: To allow the sharing of a point-to-point channel

correct_answer_content: To allow the sharing of a broadcast channel by means of a distributed algorithm
hint: In the MAC sub-level the random access protocols (Aloha, CSMA, etc.) use distributed algorithms.

question: The IEEE 802.3 standard (CSMA / CD) provides data units (also including layer 2)

options.A: Variable in size between 10 and 4500 octets
options.B: Variable in size between 64 and 1518 octets
options.C: Fixed size of 53

correct_answer_content: Variable in size between 64 and 1518 octets
hint: Review Data Link Layer & LANs concepts.

question: Which of the following statements is true?

options.A: In the commercial standard Ethernet (CSMA / CD access protocols), one is defined minimum packet size to ensure correct collision identification
options.B: In the commercial standard Ethernet (CSMA / CD access protocol), one is defined minimum packet size to distinguish packets from IEEE 802.3 standard packets
options.C: In the commercial standard Ethernet (CSMA / CD access protocol), one is defined minimum packet size to ensure better performance, in terms of traffic disposed of, al access protocol compared to what you would have with maximum size packets

correct_answer_content: In the commercial standard Ethernet (CSMA / CD access protocols), one is defined minimum packet size to ensure correct collision identification
hint: On ethernet the collision detection is a function of the length of the packet and the network extension.

question: In the header (header) TCP, or in the PCI of the TCP protocol, they are mandatory content

options.A: The TTL (Time To Live) field that allows the elimination from the network of packets that have too many routers went through
options.B: The sequence number and the ack number, for the numbering of the segment and the acknowledgments (ACK)
options.C: The fragmentation field for managing segment fragmentation

correct_answer_content: The sequence number and the ack number, for the numbering of the segment and the acknowledgments (ACK)
hint: See TCP slides for sequence and acknowledgement number fields.

question: A protocol

options.A: It is a set of semantic and syntactic rules to allow communication between two entities equal level
options.B: It is a set of semantic and syntactic rules to allow communication between two entities same system
options.C: It is a set of semantic and syntactic rules to allow communication between two systems which are linked together
options.D: It is a set of semantic and syntactic rules to allow communication between two entities different systems

correct_answer_content: It is a set of semantic and syntactic rules to allow communication between two entities equal level
hint: By definition, an entity communicates with other peer entities (same level).

question: In a Store-and-Forward packet network, increasing the number of nodes between source and destination

options.A: It leads to an increase in the delivery time, directly proportional to the size of the package
options.B: It leads to an increase in delivery time, directly proportional to the average speed of the channels
options.C: It leads to an increase in the delivery time, inversely proportional to the size of the package

correct_answer_content: It leads to an increase in the delivery time, directly proportional to the size of the package
hint: Each node must store the entire packet before forwarding, adding a delay proportional to the packet size at each hop.

question: The UDP protocol provides a service

options.A: Unreliable (i.e. no delivery guarantee) and connectionless
options.B: Reliable (i.e. with delivery guarantee) and connectionless
options.C: Unreliable (i.e. without delivery guarantee) and connection oriented

correct_answer_content: Unreliable (i.e. no delivery guarantee) and connectionless
hint: UDP implements simple, unreliable connectionless multiplexing.

question: The TCP protocol provides a service

options.A: Unreliable (i.e. no delivery guarantee) and connectionless
options.B: Reliable (i.e. with delivery guarantee) and connectionless
options.C: Unreliable (i.e. without delivery guarantee) and connection oriented
options.D: Reliable (i.e. with delivery guarantee) and connection oriented

correct_answer_content: Reliable (i.e. with delivery guarantee) and connection oriented
hint: TCP provides reliable, connection-oriented data transfer with flow and congestion control.

question: The PPP (Point-to-point-Protocol)

options.A: Use the byte-stuffing technique to ensure data transparency
options.B: Use the bit-stuffing technique to ensure data transparency
options.C: Does not guarantee the transparency of data

correct_answer_content: Use the byte-stuffing technique to ensure data transparency
hint: PPP uses a special flag byte and escapes it via byte-stuffing.

question: Comparing Fast Ethernet at 100 Mb / s (100Base T) with Ethernet at 10 Mb / s, which of the following statements is false?

options.A: The distance constraints between the nodes are more stringent
options.B: A different access protocol is used
options.C: A different physical layer is used

correct_answer_content: A different access protocol is used
hint: Both use the same CSMA/CD access protocol.

question: Which of the following protocols does not perform error detection functions on data drives?

options.A: LaPB (Link access Protocol Balanced)
options.B: IEEE 802.2 LLC (Logical Link Protocol)
options.C: PPP (Point-to-Point Protocol)
options.D: LaPF (Link access Procedure to Frame-mode bearer services)

correct_answer_content: IEEE 802.2 LLC (Logical Link Protocol)
hint: LLC (specifically Type 1) does not perform error control.

question: Which of the following statements is true?

options.A: A T1 topology, with N nodes, C channels and M1 average distance, always allows one to be disposed of lower amount of traffic of a T2 topology, with N nodes, C channels and average distance M2> M1, only with traffic evenly distributed between nodes.
options.B: A T1 topology, with N nodes, C channels and M1 average distance, always allows one to be disposed of traffic quantity lower than a T2 topology, with N nodes, C channels and average distance M2> M1, regardless of the traffic distribution.
options.C: The amount of traffic disposed of in a T1 topology, with N nodes, C channels and average distance M1, with respect to to that disposed of in a T2 topology, with N nodes, C channels and average distance M2> M1, depends on the traffic distribution between nodes

correct_answer_content: The amount of traffic disposed of in a T1 topology, with N nodes, C channels and average distance M1, with respect to to that disposed of in a T2 topology, with N nodes, C channels and average distance M2> M1, depends on the traffic distribution between nodes
hint: Network performance depends heavily on the specific traffic matrix and distribution.

question: The main differences between a Frame Relay network and an Internet IP network are possible include:

options.A: The use or non-use of aRQ (automatic Retransmission reQuest) techniques in each section of the network
options.B: The transfer of information in connection-oriented rather than non-connection-oriented mode connection
options.C: Transfer of data units of variable size instead of fixed size

correct_answer_content: The transfer of information in connection-oriented rather than non-connection-oriented mode connection
hint: Frame relay is connection-oriented (virtual circuits), IP is connectionless (datagrams).

question: Consider an Ethernet LAN with 10 nodes. Partition the network into two networks interconnected by transparent bridges. Which of the following statements is false?

options.A: The bridge separates the collision domains of the two interconnected networks
options.B: The performance of the network in terms of traffic disposed improves in any traffic condition, that is, completely independent of the distribution of traffic between nodes
options.C: The bridge introduces an additional delay in transmissions between bridged nodes
options.D: It is not necessary to change the configuration of the nodes connected to the LAN to allow a correct operation after partitioning the network

correct_answer_content: The performance of the network in terms of traffic disposed improves in any traffic condition, that is, completely independent of the distribution of traffic between nodes
hint: If all traffic is inter-segment, performance might not improve due to bridge processing.

question: Consider two LANs (Ethernet 10BaSE) A and B, connected by a bridge B1 and by a router R1 (B1 and R1 are in parallel between the two LANs). Suppose the bridge and router have both ports active and know all the addresses (MAC and IP respectively) of the hosts connected to two LANs. When a host connected to LAN A transmits an IP packet to a host connected to the LAN B

options.A: The packet is forwarded over LAN B either by the bridge or by the router, depending on the address value Destination MAC contained in the packet
options.B: The packet is forwarded on LAN B by both router R1 and bridge B1
options.C: The packet is forwarded on LAN B only by router R1
options.D: The packet is forwarded on LAN B only by bridge B1

correct_answer_content: The packet is forwarded over LAN B either by the bridge or by the router, depending on the address value Destination MAC contained in the packet
hint: Review Network Layer concepts.

question: The size of the current TCP transmitter window during a connection

options.A: It is regulated exclusively on the basis of the notification by the receiver of the size of the receiving window to perform flow control
options.B: It varies with congestion in the network and due to the flow control exercised by the receiver
options.C: It is fixed

correct_answer_content: It varies with congestion in the network and due to the flow control exercised by the receiver
hint: The sender window is the minimum between the congestion window (cwnd) and the receiver's advertised window (rwnd).

question: In the event of a segment loss identified by receiving three hits, the size of the current TCP transmitter window

options.A: It is brought to a value equal to half of the threshold
options.B: It is brought to a value equal to the threshold value
options.C: It is returned to the initial value, equal to one segment

correct_answer_content: It is brought to a value equal to half of the threshold
hint: This refers to the Fast Recovery mechanism in TCP Reno.

question: What is the order of magnitude of the maximum transmission rate on a twisted pair?

options.A: 1 Tbit / s
options.B: 1 kbit / s
options.C: 1 Mbit / s
options.D: 1 Gbit / s

correct_answer_content: 1 Gbit / s
hint: Modern twisted pair (e.g., Cat6e) supports Gbit speeds.

question: An IP router

options.A: It performs both fragmentation and reassembly of the datagram
options.B: Performs fragmentation of datagrams, but not reassembly
options.C: It does not perform datagram fragmentation
options.D: Performs fragmentation of datagrams, and reassembly only if an appropriate bit is set in the IP header

correct_answer_content: Performs fragmentation of datagrams, but not reassembly
hint: Reassembly is only done by the destination host.

question: Common channel signaling

options.A: It requires the use of signaling messages that contain the identifier of the connection to which they refer to
options.B: It is only used in packet-switched networks, because in circuit, the associated channel signaling technique is used
options.C: It cannot be used in cell or packet switched networks because it is too difficult identify connections in these networks without associating them with a signaling channel
options.D: It makes use of common transmission channels that are associated with each connection being made opening the connection itself

correct_answer_content: It requires the use of signaling messages that contain the identifier of the connection to which they refer to
hint: Common channel signaling uses a separate packet network for control messages.

question: Code division multiplexing

options.A: it is a special case of time division only
