options.B: it is a special case of frequency division only
options.C: it allows to use multiplexing and switching on the same physical medium
options.D: it does not necessarily need to be coupled to time or frequency multiplexing

correct_answer_content: it does not necessarily need to be coupled to time or frequency multiplexing
hint: CDMA is based on orthogonal codes, independent of time/frequency slots.

question: An (N) -protocol regulates interactions

options.A: between an (N) -entity and a (N-1) -SAP
options.B: between (N) -entities of the same system or of different systems
options.C: between an (N) -entity and all entities below it in the protocol stack
options.D: between an (N) -entity and the (N-1) -entity

correct_answer_content: between (N) -entities of the same system or of different systems
hint: Protocols define rules between peer entities.

question: A Go-Back-N window protocol provides that:

options.A: when a packet is received with an error, the last N data units are retransmitted
options.B: the transmitter receives feedback for the last N data units transmitted before it can start transmission of other data units
options.C: the transmitter cannot send more than N data units before having received one or more acknowledgments
options.D: every time a time-out expires, the data unit whose sequence order is equal to is retransmitted sequence number of the last transmitted data unit decreased by N

correct_answer_content: the transmitter cannot send more than N data units before having received one or more acknowledgments
hint: The window size N limits the number of unacknowledged packets.

question: Which of these HTTP statements is false?

options.A: HTTP is an application-level protocol that allows you to transfer objects on a web page
options.B: HTTP is a language that allows you to define the format of Web pages
options.C: HTTP is based on a client-server architecture
options.D: Without additional workarounds, HTTP is a stateless type protocol

correct_answer_content: HTTP is a language that allows you to define the format of Web pages
hint: HTML is the language for defining format; HTTP is the transfer protocol.

question: Using the piggybacking technique in window protocols the advantage of:

options.A: Confirm the receipt of more than one data unit through a single acknowledgment
options.B: Transmit data units even outside the transmission window
options.C: Increase the likelihood that an ACK will be received by the transmitter
options.D: Reduce the percentage of control information that is carried over the network

correct_answer_content: Reduce the percentage of control information that is carried over the network
hint: Piggybacking sends ACKs inside data packets, reducing overhead.

question: The DHCP discover message is sent over UDP using as the IP destination address:

options.A: The limited broadcast IP address 255.255.255.255
options.B: The loopback address 127.0.0.1
options.C: The IP address of the local DNS servers
options.D: The IP address of the DHCP servers on the local network

correct_answer_content: The limited broadcast IP address 255.255.255.255
hint: Review Application Layer concepts.

question: What disadvantage does datagram packet switching present compared to circuit switching?

options.A: Calculation of the routing to the source
options.B: Variability of data delays
options.C: Routing calculation at communication opening
options.D: High communication opening time

correct_answer_content: Variability of data delays
hint: Datagram switching introduces jitter (variable delay) due to independent routing.

question: In the absence of errors, the efficiency of a Stop and Wait protocol:

options.A: it is always higher than the efficiency of a Go-Back-N protocol
options.B: it is less than the efficiency of a Go-Back-N protocol only if the transmission time of a packet plus the round trip time on the channel is less than the time it takes to send the entire window transmission of the Stop and Wait protocol
options.C: it is less than the efficiency of a Go-Back-N protocol only if the transmission time of a packet is greater than the round trip propagation time on the channel
options.D: it is always less than the efficiency of a Go-Back-N protocol

correct_answer_content: it is always less than the efficiency of a Go-Back-N protocol
hint: Stop and Wait is a Go-Back-N with window size 1; if N > 1, Go-Back-N is more efficient.

question: What is the playout buffer for?

options.A: To avoid situations of congestion on the network
options.B: Access multimedia content faster thanks to local caching
options.C: To compensate for network delays in streaming multimedia content
options.D: To manage the retransmission window for multimedia contents

correct_answer_content: To compensate for network delays in streaming multimedia content
hint: Playout buffers smooth out jitter in streaming.

question: In a virtual circuit packet-switched network the number of labels used for routing it is proportional:

options.A: To the number of possible destinations
options.B: At the average number of channels outgoing from each node
options.C: The number of active connections
options.D: At the average number of nodes to cross

correct_answer_content: The number of active connections
hint: Review Network Layer concepts.

question: How are ARP messages encapsulated?

options.A: In the body of an HTTP message
options.B: Directly in an Ethernet frame
options.C: In one or more TCP segments
options.D: Directly in an IP datagram

correct_answer_content: Directly in an Ethernet frame
hint: ARP is a Layer 2 protocol that doesn't use IP headers.

question: What happens when the transmission timeout in TCP is set to a value significantly less than the round-trip time?

options.A: The time it takes to recover from segment loss situations is getting longer
options.B: Unnecessary segment retransmissions may occur
options.C: There is never any visible effect
options.D: The receiver no longer guarantees that correct data is supplied to the process listening on the socket

correct_answer_content: Unnecessary segment retransmissions may occur
hint: Early timeouts trigger retransmissions of packets that are still in flight.

question: The instability of the Aloha and Slotted Aloha protocols is caused by:

options.A: The increase in propagation delay when the traffic offered exceeds a certain threshold
options.B: The decrease in traffic disposed of when the traffic offered exceeds a certain threshold
options.C: The increase in traffic disposed of when the offered traffic exceeds a certain threshold

correct_answer_content: The decrease in traffic disposed of when the traffic offered exceeds a certain threshold
hint: High traffic leads to more collisions, reducing successful throughput.

question: Consider a host that is transmitting data using the TCP protocol. Given a transmitter current window of size equal to 10 segments, with a maximum receiver window equal to 40 segments, when the transmitter receives a segment containing an ACK from the side of the receiver, which of the following situations is impossible?

options.A: The transmitter's current window becomes 1 segment
options.B: The transmitter's current window becomes 51 segments
options.C: The current window at the transmitter becomes equal to 9 segments
options.D: The current window at the transmitter becomes equal to 5 segments

correct_answer_content: The transmitter's current window becomes 51 segments
hint: The sender window cannot exceed the receiver's advertised window (40 segments in this case).

question: Which of these fields is not contained in the header of an IPv4 datagram?

options.A: Destination IP address
options.B: Time to live (TTL)
options.C: Protocol
options.D: Destination port

correct_answer_content: Destination port
hint: The destination port is a field belonging to the transport layer (TCP/UDP), not the network layer (IP).

question: In the hierarchy provided by the DNS for the resolution of names not present in the cache, which one level is located immediately below the Root DNS Server?

options.A: Top-level domain (TLD) DNS server
options.B: Local DHCP servers
options.C: Local DNS server
options.D: Authoritative DNS servers

correct_answer_content: Top-level domain (TLD) DNS server
hint: The DNS hierarchy starts at Root, followed by TLD servers (.com, .org, .it), then Authoritative servers.

question: The current congestion window at the TCP transmitter at the start of the connection:

options.A: It has a size negotiated with the receiver and equal to half the window of the receiver
options.B: It has a size equal to a segment of maximum size (MSS)
options.C: It has a size negotiated with the receiver and equal to the maximum value of the receiver window
options.D: It has a random size chosen during the opening phase of the connection

correct_answer_content: It has a size equal to a segment of maximum size (MSS)
hint: At the start of a connection (Slow Start phase), the cwnd is initialized to 1 MSS.

question: In a packet-switched network operating in store-and-forward mode a smaller size of data units:

options.A: Decreases the number of operations that must be performed by a switch to transfer the same total amount of user information
options.B: The probability of losing the packet increases with the same probability of error on the bit
options.C: The routing complexity of each data unit decreases
options.D: Decreases the time from when a data unit reaches the input of a switch until it leaves the switch

correct_answer_content: Decreases the time from when a data unit reaches the input of a switch until it leaves the switch
hint: Smaller packets require less time to be fully received (stored) before the forwarding process can begin.

question: In a one-way ring topology, with 10 nodes and uniform unicast traffic (all nodes transmit the same amount of traffic to all others), the average number of channels traversed by a package is equal to:
hint: In a unidirectional ring of N nodes, the average distance is (N-1)/2. For N=10, it's 4.5, which rounds to 5 in this context.

question: Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) congestion control is based on:

options.A: On the variation of the number of parity bits inserted in the transmitted segments
options.B: On the trend of the size of the segments transmitted to the state of the network
options.C: About adapting the transmitter window to the receiver's memory availability
options.D: On the dynamics of the transmitter window size

correct_answer_content: On the dynamics of the transmitter window size
hint: Congestion control adjusts the congestion window (cwnd) based on perceived network loss or delay.

question: The minimum time required to send a 100Kbyte packet between two stations separated by 300 meters, using a wired network with UTP (Unshielded Twisted Pair) and crossing 3 interconnection equipment operating in store and forward mode, is of the order of:

options.A: A few seconds
options.B: It can only be calculated by knowing the transmission bit rate on the channels
options.C: A few milliseconds
options.D: Hundreds of milliseconds

correct_answer_content: It can only be calculated by knowing the transmission bit rate on the channels
hint: Without the transmission rate (bandwidth), the serialization delay (the dominant factor) cannot be determined.

question: What are the source and destination port fields in TCP and UDP for?

options.A: To implement a multiplexing / demultiplexing mechanism for processes on hosts
options.B: To manage the allocation of resources on the router on the path from source to destination
options.C: To indicate the network interfaces on which packets will be forwarded by IP
options.D: To indicate the physical interfaces on which the frames will be transmitted by Ethernet

correct_answer_content: To implement a multiplexing / demultiplexing mechanism for processes on hosts
hint: Ports allow the transport layer to direct data to the specific application process (socket) on a host.

question: Among the fundamental functions of the transport layer in the OSI model we find:

options.A: Exchange of labels in circuit switching
options.B: Reading data from a terminal device
options.C: Recovery of transmission errors
options.D: Data drive routing

correct_answer_content: Recovery of transmission errors
hint: The transport layer (like TCP) provides end-to-end error recovery and reliability.

question: At the same rate of information transmitted, which of the following line codings it requires a physically lower bitrate?

options.A: 12B15B encoding
options.B: 4B5B encoding
options.C: They all require the same bit rate
options.D: 8B10B encoding

correct_answer_content: They all require the same bit rate
hint: If the "rate of information transmitted" refers to the effective bit rate, the physical line rate adapts to the overhead of each specific encoding.

question: If a router receives an IP packet, with correct checksum, with source IP address and destination equal and TTL field = 9

options.A: It routes it to the destination
options.B: It still forwards it to the destination, however sending an ICMP packet to the source for report the error
options.C: It discards it and sends an ICMP error packet to the source
options.D: Discard the package

correct_answer_content: It routes it to the destination
hint: While unusual, an IP packet with the same source/destination is valid (loopback or local delivery) as long as the checksum and TTL are valid.

question: The preamble in the Ethernet packet:

options.A: It allows to recognize transmission errors
options.B: Used to identify the type of protocol transported in the data field of the Ethernet packet
options.C: It allows you to identify the application process to which to deliver the package
options.D: It is necessary to allow the receiver node to tune its clock with the clock of the transmitter node

correct_answer_content: It is necessary to allow the receiver node to tune its clock with the clock of the transmitter node
hint: The preamble provides a bit pattern for clock synchronization between transmitter and receiver.

question: Two IP stations 130.192.40.1/24 and 130.192.40.200/24

options.A: They have no valid IP addresses
options.B: They can exchange IP packets directly
options.C: They can only exchange IP packets via a router
options.D: They cannot exchange IP packets

correct_answer_content: They can exchange IP packets directly
hint: Since they share the same subnet prefix (/24), they are on the same local network and can communicate directly.

question: The protocol SMTP

options.A: it is used by a mail client to get a mail message from a server
options.B: allows a mail server to tell another mail server who the sender of a mail server is message
options.C: allows a mail server to verify the identity of a user who wants to send a message
options.D: it is based on the telnet protocol

correct_answer_content: allows a mail server to tell another mail server who the sender of a mail server is message
hint: SMTP is used for "pushing" mail from client to server or between servers.

question: TCP messages contain a sequence number indicating

options.A: the next byte the receiver expects to receive
options.B: the message number in the sequence of messages transmitted over the TCP connection
options.C: the sequence number of the message in a set of fragments produced by fragmenting a bigger message
options.D: the position of the first byte of the message in the sequence of bytes transmitted on the TCP connection

correct_answer_content: the position of the first byte of the message in the sequence of bytes transmitted on the TCP connection
hint: TCP sequence numbers track bytes, not packets, identifying the position of the first byte in the stream.

question: Congestion control in TCP

options.A: imposes a maximum number of TCP connections that a station can open
options.B: is based on information received from routers present on the path
options.C: is present only for some types of connection
options.D: limits the size of the transmission window

correct_answer_content: limits the size of the transmission window
hint: Congestion control effectively caps the window size to match network capacity.

question: In the WI-FI protocol with DCF and handshaking

options.A: sending the RTS and CTS packets reduces the probability of collisions on the data packets
options.B: collisions are completely avoided thanks to the carrier sense mechanism
options.C: sending the RTS packets and the CTS allows two terminals, one of which is hidden, to send their plots at the same time
options.D: collisions on any type of data transmitted are completely avoided

correct_answer_content: sending the RTS and CTS packets reduces the probability of collisions on the data packets
hint: The RTS/CTS mechanism addresses the "hidden node" problem, reducing collisions on large data frames.

question: The HEAD method of the HTTP protocol is used to:

options.A: get the header of a web page
options.B: send only the header of an HTTP request
options.C: change the header, or home page, of a web server
options.D: receive only the HTTP response header

correct_answer_content: receive only the HTTP response header
hint: HEAD requests the same response as GET but without the message body.

question: The receipt on node A of an ICMP Echo Reply packet sent by node B indicates that

options.A: A and B are able to exchange IP packets
options.B: A is able to send IP packets to B but not vice versa
options.C: B is able to send IP packets to A but not vice versa
options.D: B is able to send IP packets to A but vice versa is not guaranteed

correct_answer_content: A and B are able to exchange IP packets
hint: An Echo Reply proves that the request reached B and the response reached A.

question: The ARP Request frame is used for learning

options.A: the MAC address of a station connected to an IP network other than that of the source
options.B: the IP address of an Ethernet node directly connected to the source node
options.C: the IP address of a station given its internet name
options.D: the MAC address of an IP node directly connected to the source node

correct_answer_content: the MAC address of an IP node directly connected to the source node
hint: ARP resolves a known IP address to a MAC address on the same local segment.

question: The DHCP protocol

options.A: it is used for automatic configuration of an IP station
options.B: it only provides IP stations with private type addresses
options.C: provides the stations with the IP address corresponding to a given domain name
options.D: it does not allow a station to reuse the same IP address already used during a previous connection to the local network

correct_answer_content: it is used for automatic configuration of an IP station
hint: DHCP assigns IP addresses, masks, gateways, and DNS server info automatically.

question: Given a topology (nodes, channels and associated costs), the optimal path between a source and a destination

options.A: it never changes even if a channel becomes unavailable
options.B: it changes depending on the node running the link state algorithm
options.C: it is the same whether a link state algorithm is used or a distance vector algorithm is used
options.D: it never changes even if the cost of the channels changes

correct_answer_content: it is the same whether a link state algorithm is used or a distance vector algorithm is used
hint: Both algorithms are designed to find the shortest path based on the same metrics; they just use different methods.

question: When an Ethernet switch receives an ARP Request packet

options.A: it only forwards it to the port to which the network's DHCP server is connected
options.B: forwards it on all ports except the one from which the packet was received
options.C: it forwards it only on ports on which multicast traffic has been enabled
options.D: it only forwards it on the port to which the destination node / host is connected

correct_answer_content: forwards it on all ports except the one from which the packet was received
hint: ARP Requests are broadcast at the MAC layer; a switch floods broadcast frames to all ports except the source.

question: IP version 4 addresses are:

options.A: randomly assigned to the various stations connected to the internet, regardless of theirs position
options.B: assigned by the manufacturers of the network cards
options.C: generally assigned on a geographical and topological basis, in order to favor their aggregation

correct_answer_content: generally assigned on a geographical and topological basis, in order to favor their aggregation
hint: Hierarchical addressing allows routers to use a single routing table entry for a large block of addresses (aggregation).

question: The slow start phase in TCP

options.A: expects the congestion window to remain at a very low value for the duration of the connection
options.B: it is one of the phases that carry out the flow control
options.C: it allows the congestion window to grow quickly starting from a very initial value low
options.D: allows the congestion window to grow slowly in order to avoid situations congestion

correct_answer_content: it allows the congestion window to grow quickly starting from a very initial value low
hint: Despite the name, Slow Start doubles the cwnd every RTT, leading to exponential growth.

question: The minimum packet size in the CSMA / CD protocol of the Ethernet network

options.A: it is necessary to ensure recognition of the collision
options.B: it is preferable to maximize performance in terms of traffic disposed of
options.C: it is necessary to ensure that you avoid causing multiple consecutive collisions on the same packet
options.D: it does not depend in any way on the maximum allowed size (in meters) of the network

correct_answer_content: it is necessary to ensure recognition of the collision
hint: The packet must be long enough so the transmitter is still sending when a collision signal from the far end of the cable returns.

question: A ring topology may be preferable to a mesh topology because:

options.A: it can carry data and voice communications at the same time
options.B: routing is simpler
options.C: it is more robust to failure
options.D: allows bi-directional paths

correct_answer_content: routing is simpler
hint: Routing in a ring is trivial (send left or right), whereas mesh requires complex routing tables.

question: Two stations in the same collision domain on an Ethernet network

options.A: they can create a collision only in the case of exactly simultaneous transmission
options.B: they can never create a collision thanks to the carrier sense operation typical of the protocol CSMA-CD
options.C: they identify the collision thanks to a NACK frame sent by the switch on which they are connected
options.D: they can create a collision when they transmit a packet

correct_answer_content: they can create a collision when they transmit a packet
hint: Collisions are a fundamental characteristic of shared media/collision domains.

question: The TCP segments sent from host A to host B contain an acknowledgment number (Acknowledgment number) indicating:

options.A: the next byte host B expects to receive
options.B: the next byte host A expects to receive in the segments sent from host B
options.C: the position of the segment in the sequence of segments transmitted on the TCP connection
options.D: the position of the first byte of the segment in the sequence of bytes transmitted on the TCP connection

correct_answer_content: the next byte host A expects to receive in the segments sent from host B
hint: ACKs are "next-byte expected" numbers, informing the other side of what was successfully received.

question: A node using a Selective Repeat windowed protocol with cumulative semantics of ACK to receive data from another node is expected to deliver a duplicate PDU. Assuming none given it was lost, which of the following reasons is most likely the cause of this behavior?

options.A: The receiver window is too small
options.B: transmitter timeout is too short
options.C: transmitter timeout is too long
options.D: the transmitter window is too small

correct_answer_content: transmitter timeout is too short
hint: If the timeout is shorter than the RTT, the sender will retransmit before the ACK can arrive.

question: A node using a Go-Back-N windowed protocol with cumulative ACK semantics to receive data from another node, a duplicate PDU is delivered. Which of the following actions undertakes?

options.A: Always send an ACK for the expected sequence number
options.B: if the PDU is within the receiving window, it always sends an ACK relative to the sequence number of the duplicated PDU
options.C: sends an ACK relative to the expected sequence number only if the timeout has not yet expired transmitter
options.D: always sends an ACK regarding the sequence number of the duplicated PDU

correct_answer_content: Always send an ACK for the expected sequence number
hint: In GBN, the receiver re-acknowledges the last correctly received in-order packet.

question: The IP protocol

options.A: implements the transport layer of the Internet network
options.B: makes a large network more scalable thanks to address aggregation
options.C: it is not used in local networks as the Ethernet technology is adequate
options.D: provides the mechanisms for accessing a shared medium

correct_answer_content: makes a large network more scalable thanks to address aggregation
hint: IP's hierarchical structure is what allows the Internet to scale via routing table aggregation.

question: A routing protocol

options.A: involves exchanging information on the state of the network to build routing tables
options.B: defines the operations to be performed to forward individual packets on the outbound port
options.C: defines the operations to be performed to choose the path to the destination
options.D: it uses routing tables but only in the case of circuit switching

correct_answer_content: involves exchanging information on the state of the network to build routing tables
hint: Review Network Layer concepts.

question: In the ATM protocol of the B-ISDN network, the data units, called cells, are small in size (48byte + 5byte header)

options.A: to segment the data units of the IP protocol into cells in order to decrease the probability of data loss
options.B: to improve the relationship between headers and user data in the cell
options.C: to reduce the packaging time (package creation) to transfer the voice for real-time applications
options.D: to increase the transfer speed of a large file thanks to the efficient segmentation and reassembly process

correct_answer_content: to reduce the packaging time (package creation) to transfer the voice for real-time applications
hint: Small cell sizes minimize packetization delay, which is critical for real-time voice services.

question: The DNS

options.A: it is a system used for the automatic configuration of the domain name on the hosts on the network Internet
options.B: is a distributed database that, given a search key, allows you to identify, within one server hierarchy, a record of a specified type
options.C: is a system used by the IANA to delegate the assignment of domain names (Top Level Domain)
options.D: is a server that is installed within a corporate network and contains the correspondence between name and address of any host on the internet

correct_answer_content: is a distributed database that, given a search key, allows you to identify, within one server hierarchy, a record of a specified type
hint: DNS is a distributed, hierarchical database primarily used to map hostnames to IP addresses.

question: Simultaneous sharing of the same physical channel between different sources can take place

options.A: through frequency multiplexing
options.B: through circuit multiplexing
options.C: through circuit switching
options.D: through virtual circuit packet switching

correct_answer_content: through frequency multiplexing
hint: Frequency Division Multiplexing (FDM) allows multiple signals to share the same medium by using different frequency bands simultaneously.

question: The IP network can be assigned to an Ethernet network containing 200 stations
hint: A /24 network provides 254 usable addresses, which fits 200 stations. A /25 only provides 126, and a /26 only 62.

question: The TCP segments

options.A: they have a fixed size negotiated when the connection is established
options.B: have a fixed size specified by the TCP standard
options.C: they vary in size which is decided on the basis of the level of congestion on the network
options.D: they vary in size which does not depend on the level of congestion on the network

correct_answer_content: they vary in size which does not depend on the level of congestion on the network
hint: While the window size depends on congestion, the individual segment size (up to MSS) is determined by MTU and application data, not network congestion levels.

question: To reduce the packaging delay it is advisable

options.A: increase the size of the header
options.B: choose a nearby destination
options.C: reduce the size of the PDU data field
options.D: use a contention access protocol

correct_answer_content: reduce the size of the PDU data field
hint: Reducing the payload size means the transmitter spends less time "filling" the packet before sending it.

question: In a UTP cable (Unshielded Twisted Pair) the signal transmission takes place by exploiting

options.A: the difference between the voltages of different pairs of conductors
options.B: the difference between the voltages on the components of a pair of conductors
options.C: the difference between the voltage of a single conductor and the "earth"
options.D: the difference between the voltage of a single conductor and the metallic braid

correct_answer_content: the difference between the voltages on the components of a pair of conductors
hint: Differential signaling on a twisted pair uses the voltage difference between the two wires in the pair to cancel out electromagnetic interference.

question: Considering the transmission of a single packet in a multiple access network

options.A: the ALOHA protocol always guarantees the same access delay as that of the protocol SLOTTED ALOHA
options.B: the SLOTTED ALOHA protocol guarantees a shorter access delay than the protocol ALOHA
options.C: it is preferable to use an ordered access protocol to reduce the access delay
options.D: the ALOHA protocol guarantees a shorter access delay than that of the SLOTTED protocol ALOHA

correct_answer_content: the ALOHA protocol guarantees a shorter access delay than that of the SLOTTED protocol ALOHA
hint: In Slotted ALOHA, a node must wait for the start of the next slot; in pure ALOHA, it can transmit immediately.

question: Flow control

options.A: it is offered by UDP using a special field in the header
options.B: it is offered by both TCP and UDP as it is fundamental in the realization of a end-to-end communication
options.C: it is not offered by either TCP or UDP as it is already present in the lower level protocols
options.D: it is offered by TCP using a special field in the header

correct_answer_content: it is offered by TCP using a special field in the header
hint: TCP uses the "Receive Window" field in its header to implement flow control.

question: An example of multiple access is represented by

options.A: base station that transmits to mobile terminals of a cellular network
options.B: local fixed telephone exchange
options.C: television broadcasts radiated by satellite
options.D: mobile terminals that transmit to the base station in a cellular network

correct_answer_content: mobile terminals that transmit to the base station in a cellular network
hint: Multiple mobile terminals compete to access the shared uplink channel to the base station.

question: Which of the following functions are not performed by the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP)?

options.A: Congestion control
options.B: Maintenance of the byte sequence
options.C: Multiplexing / demultiplexing through the door mechanism
options.D: Choice of packet routing

correct_answer_content: Choice of packet routing
hint: Routing is a Network Layer (Layer 3 - IP) function, not a Transport Layer (Layer 4) function.

question: For a transmitter that implements an ARQ (Automatic Retransmission reQuest), the receipt of a succession of hits containing the same sequence number is a symptom from

options.A: an increase in the duration of the timeout
options.B: a loss of acknowledgment data drive (ACK)
options.C: an increase in the bandwidth availability between transmitter and receiver
options.D: a loss of a data unit of information

correct_answer_content: a loss of a data unit of information
hint: Duplicate ACKs are sent by the receiver when it receives out-of-order segments, usually indicating that an intermediate segment was lost.

question: Which of the following functions is not characteristic of the second architectural level of the OSI model?

options.A: delimitation of data units
options.B: addressing on the local network
options.C: error checking on data drives
options.D: end-to-end routing of data drives

correct_answer_content: end-to-end routing of data drives
hint: Routing is the primary function of the Network Layer (Level 3).

question: Which of the following statements applies to Fast Ethernet in full-duplex mode (bidirectional)?

options.A: The full-duplex mode can be used between a user station and a switch port, or between the ports of two switches
options.B: The full-duplex mode does not allow a greater distance between a user station and one switch
options.C: The full-duplex mode allows you to interconnect switches in a ring topology
options.D: The full-duplex mode does not increase the amount of information that can be disposed of between a user station and a switch, compared to half-duplex mode

correct_answer_content: The full-duplex mode can be used between a user station and a switch port, or between the ports of two switches
hint: Full-duplex eliminates collisions, allowing simultaneous transmission and reception between two point-to-point entities.

question: The TCP transmitter window control algorithm switches from the slow-start phase to congestion avoidance (AIMD)

options.A: upon notification by the receiver
options.B: when the current window reaches a threshold value
options.C: after a timeout expires
options.D: as soon as an out of sequence feedback is received

correct_answer_content: when the current window reaches a threshold value
hint: The transition occurs when cwnd reaches the ssthresh (slow start threshold).

question: In a packet-switched network of the virtual circuit type, the algorithm of routing applies to switching nodes

options.A: to all packets received
options.B: only to the request packets for opening and closing the virtual circuit
options.C: to data packets only
options.D: to the virtual circuit opening request packets only

correct_answer_content: to the virtual circuit opening request packets only
hint: Routing decisions are made during the signaling phase (opening the circuit); subsequent data packets simply follow the established path using labels.

question: Which of these statements regarding peer-to-peer architectures is false?

options.A: They are self-scaling, i.e. the performances do not change drastically as the number of peer
options.B: The peers are located in large data centers and are managed by the same administrator
options.C: Resources usually remain accessible even if some peers are turned off
options.D: Peers can change their IP address over time

correct_answer_content: The peers are located in large data centers and are managed by the same administrator
hint: P2P is characterized by decentralized control and resources located at the edge (user devices), not central data centers.

question: Which of these statements regarding datagram routing in IP networks is true?

options.A: It is done by routers on the basis of the destination IP address
options.B: It is done by routers on the basis of the source IP address
options.C: It is performed by routers on the basis of the virtual-circuit (VC) identifier
options.D: IP is based on circuit switching, so no routing is done

correct_answer_content: It is done by routers on the basis of the destination IP address
hint: Review Network Layer concepts.

question: The fact that the Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) operates on point-to-point links involves, among other things:

options.A: That PPP should use MAC layer addresses to distinguish sender and recipient
options.B: That it is not necessary to use addresses in the PPP header
options.C: That PPP should send the identity of the recipient to the higher levels
options.D: That the PPP frames have a fixed length

correct_answer_content: That it is not necessary to use addresses in the PPP header
hint: In a direct point-to-point link, there is only one possible receiver, making individual addressing unnecessary.

question: Which of the following is necessary to make the operation of a window protocol in case of non-sequential channel between transmitter and receiver?

options.A: Use of cumulative confirmations
options.B: Increase of the bits in the address fields of the data units
options.C: Choice of transmission and reception windows of equal size
options.D: Increase of the bits used for the numbering of the data units

correct_answer_content: Increase of the bits used for the numbering of the data units
hint: More sequence number bits are needed to distinguish between new and old (delayed) packets on a non-sequential channel.

question: Which of these statements about TCP's retransmission mechanism is false?

options.A: Receiving a triple duplicate ACK causes retransmission of the oldest segment awaiting confirmation
options.B: A timeout causes retransmission of the oldest segment awaiting confirmation
options.C: A timeout causes retransmission of all segments awaiting confirmation
options.D: Receiving an ACK cumulatively confirms all previous segments as well

correct_answer_content: A timeout causes retransmission of all segments awaiting confirmation
hint: TCP typically retransmits only the specific segment that timed out (or the one identified by triple duplicate ACKs).

question: Which of these DASH statements is false?:

options.A: It is based on the availability of different bit encoded versions of the same multimedia content installments
options.B: It produces messages that are packaged in RTP to make internet telephony
options.C: Make a compromise between available network bandwidth and multimedia content quality
options.D: It is used for streaming multimedia content over HTTP

correct_answer_content: It produces messages that are packaged in RTP to make internet telephony
hint: DASH (Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP) is for video streaming, not real-time RTP-based telephony.

question: In datagram type packet switching it is foreseen:

options.A: An allocation of transmission resources only for the duration of packet transmission
options.B: A statistical choice between frequency multiplexing and time multiplexing
options.C: A preventive allocation of transmission resources based on source activity statistics
options.D: A permanent allocation of transmission resources to different information flows

correct_answer_content: An allocation of transmission resources only for the duration of packet transmission
hint: Review Network Layer concepts.

question: The TCP protocol dynamically varies the size of the current window at the transmitter to obtain:

options.A: The window does not change
options.B: Both flow control and congestion control
options.C: Congestion Control Only
options.D: Flow control only

correct_answer_content: Both flow control and congestion control
hint: TCP window size is limited by both the network capacity (congestion window) and the receiver's capacity (advertised window).

question: Which of the following is NOT an example of multiple access?

options.A: A switch that transmits packets on an output interface in a switched network package
options.B: Aloha stations towards the Master station
options.C: Smartphones transmitting to a base station in the access network of a cellular network
options.D: Transmission of computers equipped with a WIFI card to an Access Point

correct_answer_content: A switch that transmits packets on an output interface in a switched network package
hint: A switch port output is typically a point-to-point link to the next node; the others involve shared media.

question: There exists at least one tree topology with 5 nodes and 4 channels in which, if a channel is added between two nodes not directly connected to each other, the topology:

options.A: Becomes a ring topology
options.B: Remains a tree topology
options.C: Becomes a star topology
options.D: Become a fully connected topology

correct_answer_content: Becomes a ring topology
hint: Review Network Topologies concepts.

question: Which of these DHCP claims is false?

options.A: DHCP dynamically supplies an IP address to a requesting host
options.B: Among the information provided by the DHCP server there is also the default gateway address
options.C: DHCP messages are enveloped in UDP datagrams sent in broadcast
options.D: There can be at most one DHCP server on a network

correct_answer_content: There can be at most one DHCP server on a network
hint: Multiple DHCP servers can coexist on a network for redundancy or different subnet management.

question: In the IP header, or in the PCI of the IP protocol, it is mandatory content:

options.A: The Time To Live field that allows the elimination from the network of packets that have passed through too many routers
options.B: The source MAC address, useful for sending replies to received packets
options.C: The ACK Number field for the numbering of the hits (ACK)
options.D: The CODE field, which contains the SYN, FIN and ACK flags for opening and closing the connection

correct_answer_content: The Time To Live field that allows the elimination from the network of packets that have passed through too many routers
hint: TTL is an IP header field; MAC addresses are Layer 2, and ACKs/Flags are Layer 4 (TCP).

question: A link state routing algorithm provides that:

options.A: Each node of the network communicates the information on the cost of transmission to all the nodes of the network towards the nodes adjacent to it
options.B: Each node in the network generates its own routing tables and then distributes them to the nodes only adjacent
options.C: Each node in the network communicates information on cost and direction to the nodes adjacent to it of the roads that lead to every possible destination
options.D: Each node on the network generates its own routing tables and then distributes them to everyone else network nodes

correct_answer_content: Each node of the network communicates the information on the cost of transmission to all the nodes of the network towards the nodes adjacent to it
hint: Link-state (OSPF) involves flooding local connectivity info to all nodes so everyone can build the full map.

question: In an Ethernet network where terminals are connected in full-duplex mode to the ports of one switch using a UTP cable:

options.A: The CSMA / CD access protocol is in fact useless because the switch separates the collision domains between its doors
options.B: The CSMA / CD access protocol is in fact useless because the switch works at higher bit rates or equal to 1GB / s, making frames short-lived
options.C: The CSMA / CD access protocol is still used for bit rates below 100Mb / s
options.D: The CSMA / CD access protocol is still used, but only in case two transmissions begin at the same time

correct_answer_content: The CSMA / CD access protocol is in fact useless because the switch separates the collision domains between its doors
hint: Full-duplex switching creates dedicated, collision-free paths.

question: Over a time interval T, a transmitter node using a windowed protocol Go-Back-N with window equal to 5 PDUs transmits PDUs numbered 9, 10, 11 and receives ACK (cumulative) 8. Assuming the timeout has not expired and ACK 8 is the one with the highest sequence number received up to this point, which of the following actions is allowed by the protocol rules in this one situation?

options.A: Send PDU 12
options.B: Send PDU 8
options.C: Send PDUs 12 and 13
options.D: No action until more ACKs are received

correct_answer_content: Send PDU 12
hint: Review Error & Flow Control concepts.

question: A (N) -PDU (Protocol Data Unit), passing to level (N-1) becomes:

options.A: One or more (N) -SDUs (Service Data Units)
options.B: One or more (N-1) -SDU (Service Data Unit)
options.C: Una (N-1) -PCI (Protocol Control Information)
options.D: One or more (N-1) -SDUs (Service Data Units) to which N-PCI are added

correct_answer_content: One or more (N-1) -SDU (Service Data Unit)
hint: Data encapsulation: a PDU at one layer becomes the payload (SDU) for the layer below.

question: The Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) allows you to:

options.A: Obtain an unknown IP address of a host from a domain name
options.B: Send error messages between routers
options.C: Obtain an unknown MAC address of a host from an IP address
options.D: Obtain an unknown IP address of a host from a MAC address

correct_answer_content: Obtain an unknown MAC address of a host from an IP address
hint: ARP maps Layer 3 (IP) addresses to Layer 2 (Physical/MAC) addresses.

question: Which of these Web cookie statements is false?

options.A: A browser in possession of a cookie includes it in subsequent requests to its HTTP server
options.B: The browser creates a different cookie every time it accesses the same HTTP server
options.C: The cookie is created by the HTTP server when a browser logs in for the first time
options.D: The cookie is stored by the browser in the client host's file system

correct_answer_content: The browser creates a different cookie every time it accesses the same HTTP server
hint: The server creates the cookie to identify a returning user; the browser sends back the same existing cookie rather than creating a new one.

question: Which of the following statements about the comparison between the Aloha and Slotted-Aloha protocols is true?

options.A: Collisions in Aloha can occur at any time, while in Slotted-Aloha they coincide with the beginning of the plots
options.B: Broadcasts in Aloha can start at any time, while in Slotted-Aloha they must be preceded by a channel reservation slot
options.C: The transmission in Slotted-Aloha must be preceded by listening to the channel, while in Aloha it can happen as soon as the plot is available
options.D: Unlike Slotted-Aloha, Aloha's performance depends on propagation delays

correct_answer_content: Collisions in Aloha can occur at any time, while in Slotted-Aloha they coincide with the beginning of the plots
hint: Slotted-Aloha restricts transmissions to the start of discrete time slots, reducing the collision window.

question: In the event that an error in the configuration of the forwarding tables on the routers generates a closed path on the net, which of these statements is true?

options.A: A datagram that circulates on that path is sooner or later deleted by routers on the basis of the TTL field
options.B: The spanning tree protocol prevents these problems from arising before they arise
options.C: A datagram can circulate on this path indefinitely
options.D: A datagram that circulates on this path is sooner or later eliminated by the routers, which detect it comparing the content to the copies kept in the local cache

correct_answer_content: A datagram that circulates on that path is sooner or later deleted by routers on the basis of the TTL field
hint: The Time To Live (TTL) field is decremented by each router; when it reaches zero, the packet is discarded to prevent infinite loops.

question: The transmission delay of a PDU in a packet switching network:

options.A: It depends on the size of the PDU and the distance between the transmitter and receiver
options.B: It just depends on the bit rate of the transmitter
options.C: It depends on the bit rate of the transmitter and the distance between the transmitter and the receiver
options.D: It depends on the bit rate of the transmitter and the size of the PDU

correct_answer_content: It depends on the bit rate of the transmitter and the size of the PDU
hint: Transmission delay = (Size of PDU in bits) / (Bit rate in bps). Distance affects propagation delay, not transmission delay.

question: Consider an extended LAN in Ethernet technology whose nodes are interconnected by transparent switches. Which of the following statements is false?

options.A: Switches can support the creation of Virtual LANs
options.B: Switches introduce additional delay in transmissions between nodes connected through the switches themselves
options.C: It is necessary to change the configuration of the nodes connected to the LAN to allow correct routing of MAC frames between switches
options.D: The switches separate the collision domains of the interconnected network portions

correct_answer_content: It is necessary to change the configuration of the nodes connected to the LAN to allow correct routing of MAC frames between switches
hint: Switches are transparent; end nodes do not need any special configuration to work through them.

question: Regarding the reception of an out of sequence segment in TCP, which one of these statements is true?

options.A: The reordering of segments is the responsibility of the RTP protocol
options.B: The receiver immediately delivers the segment to the higher protocol levels
options.C: The receiver always discards the segment which is to be transmitted again
options.D: The receiver returns an acknowledgment number referring to the next expected byte

correct_answer_content: The receiver returns an acknowledgment number referring to the next expected byte
hint: TCP uses cumulative acknowledgments; it ACKs the last in-order byte received, even if higher-sequence segments have arrived.

question: With the same number of bits of information transmitted, which of the following line codings requires a physically higher bit rate?

options.A: 4B5B encoding
options.B: Polar coding NRZ
options.C: Manchester coding
options.D: Unipolar coding

correct_answer_content: Manchester coding
hint: Manchester encoding requires 2 symbols per bit, effectively doubling the required baud rate/bandwidth compared to NRZ.

question: During the slow-start phase of the TCP management control, the window transmitter current:

options.A: It grows by one segment for each acknowledgment (ACK) received
options.B: Double for each acknowledgment (ACK) received
options.C: It is halved for each missing ACK
options.D: It remains constant over time

correct_answer_content: It grows by one segment for each acknowledgment (ACK) received
hint: In slow start, the congestion window (cwnd) increases by 1 MSS for every individual ACK received.

question: Which of the following services are possible thanks to the Store & Forward in a packet network?

options.A: The possibility of having different transmission speeds between the different channels attested to one same switch
options.B: The reduction of delays in transferring information through a node switch
options.C: The possibility of using forward error correction channel encodings
options.D: The reduction of the packet header size

correct_answer_content: The possibility of having different transmission speeds between the different channels attested to one same switch
hint: Because the switch buffers the entire packet, it can receive it at one speed and transmit it at another.

question: Why does VDSL technology have high performance only if the distance between street cabin and user's home is less than a hundred meters?

options.A: Because the connections have to go through fewer intermediate nodes
options.B: Because the end-to-end delay between the user's home and the operator's control panel is reduced
options.C: Because the costs of laying cables are reduced
options.D: Because the shorter length of the copper cable allows the use of bit rate modulations high

correct_answer_content: Because the shorter length of the copper cable allows the use of bit rate modulations high
hint: Higher frequency signals allow higher bit rates but attenuate very quickly over copper distance.

question: An IP router after calculating the route:

options.A: Change the source and destination IP addresses in the datagram header
options.B: Only change the Time To Live (TTL) field in the datagram header
options.C: Change only in the Header Checksum field in the datagram header
options.D: Edit the Time To Live and Header Checksum fields in the datagram header

correct_answer_content: Edit the Time To Live and Header Checksum fields in the datagram header
hint: The router decrements the TTL, which necessitates a recalculation of the Header Checksum.

question: The Stop & Wait protocol

options.A: It can work using a number of numbering bits greater than or equal to 1
options.B: It can only work using more than one numbering bit
options.C: It can only work using fewer numbering bits than the size of the transmission window
options.D: It can only work using a single numbering bit

correct_answer_content: It can work using a number of numbering bits greater than or equal to 1
hint: While 1 bit is the minimum (alternating bit protocol), more bits can be used without breaking the logic.

question: The TCP transmission window control algorithm passes from the slow-start to congestion avoidance (AIMD)

options.A: Upon notification by the receiver
options.B: After the timeout expires
options.C: As soon as an out of sequence feedback is received
options.D: When the current window reaches a threshold value

correct_answer_content: When the current window reaches a threshold value
hint: The threshold is known as ssthresh (slow start threshold).

question: Which of the following is a consequence of increasing the number of numbering bits in the data units of a windowing protocol?

options.A: Increase in the number of possible virtual circuits
options.B: Increase in malfunctions due to non-sequential channel between transmitter and receiver
options.C: Potential increase in protocol throughput
options.D: Failure to detect collisions on broadcast channel

correct_answer_content: Potential increase in protocol throughput
hint: A higher number of bits allows for a larger transmission window, preventing the transmitter from stopping while waiting for ACKs on channels with a high Bandwidth-Delay Product, thus increasing throughput.

question: Which of these statements regarding TCP slow start is false?

options.A: Upon reaching a threshold (ssthresh) it switches to congestion avoidance mode
options.B: It is based on an exponential increase of the congestion window (cwnd)
options.C: It constantly maintains low throughput in TCP to avoid network congestion
options.D: It is executed following a timeout event that occurs on the connection

correct_answer_content: It constantly maintains low throughput in TCP to avoid network congestion
hint: Slow Start does not maintain low throughput; on the contrary, it increases it exponentially to quickly discover the maximum available capacity of the network.

question: Flow control in TCP:

options.A: Bases its operations on the receive window (rwnd) field in TCP segment headers
options.B: Is managed by the default gateway that limits the throughput of datagrams sent on the network
options.C: Bases its operations on TCP timeout and reception of duplicate ACKs
options.D: Requires establishment of a virtual circuit through intermediate routers

correct_answer_content: Bases its operations on the receive window (rwnd) field in TCP segment headers
hint: Flow control is an end-to-end mechanism where the receiver informs the transmitter of its remaining buffer space using the "Receive Window" field.

question: Which of these statements regarding Real Time Protocol is false?

options.A: Can be used to carry multimedia streams in IP telephony
options.B: Is an application layer protocol that normally relies on UDP
options.C: Offers guarantees on transmission times on the internet
options.D: Allows specifying the codec used for the multimedia stream

correct_answer_content: Offers guarantees on transmission times on the internet
hint: RTP provides timestamps and sequence numbers to manage jitter and reordering, but it cannot offer "guarantees" on transmission times as it depends on the underlying network state.

question: A line coding and a digital modulation:

options.A: Can both be used for transmission on radio media
options.B: Can only be used for transmission on electrical media
options.C: Can only be used for transmission on electrical media (the first) and radio media (the second)
options.D: Can both be used for transmission on optical fiber

correct_answer_content: Can only be used for transmission on electrical media (the first) and radio media (the second)
hint: Line codings (baseband) are suitable for guided media like copper or fiber, while digital modulation (passband) is necessary for radio media to shift the signal to the desired frequency.

question: In a Selective Repeat protocol with receive window equal to 2 PDUs, and initially positioned on sequence numbers 0 and 1, the following reception of PDUs in the indicated order does not result in PDU discard:
hint: In Selective Repeat with Wr=2 positioned on [0,1], the receiver accepts packets 0 and 1 in any order. Once both are received, the window slides to [2,3]. In option D, 1 and 0 arrive (accepted), the window slides, and then 3 and 2 arrive (accepted).

question: A routing table contains, simultaneously, all four of the following entries. Identify the entry selected following forwarding procedures for a datagram with destination 130.192.15.200:
hint: Longest Prefix Match rule. The address 130.192.15.200 belongs to the subnet 130.192.15.128/25 (range .128 to .255). Since /25 is the most specific mask, this entry is selected.

question: The term "Roaming" in a cellular network indicates:

options.A: The overlap of multiple cells in a specific area of the territory
options.B: The possibility of tracking a terminal regardless of the cell it is in
options.C: The persistence of connection even when moving to an adjacent cell
options.D: The speed of movement of a terminal from one cell to another

correct_answer_content: The possibility of tracking a terminal regardless of the cell it is in
hint: Roaming allows a terminal to be located and to make/receive calls even when under the coverage of a network other than its home network.

question: A packet begins reception at a switching node at time t=15ms and ends at t=35ms. Assuming there are no other packets in queue and processing time is negligible, its forwarding on an output channel having quadruple speed compared to the input channel is completed at time:

options.A: t=40ms
options.B: t=45ms
options.C: Depends on propagation time to destination
options.D: t=50ms

correct_answer_content: t=40ms
hint: The reception time (serialization on the first link) is 35 - 15 = 20 ms. Since the output channel is 4 times faster, the transmission time will be 20 / 4 = 5 ms. In store-and-forward mode, transmission starts at t=35 ms and ends at 35 + 5 = 40 ms.

question: In a WiFi network, sending an ACK for a unicast frame by the receiver is:

options.A: Not necessary if the channel has been reserved through RTS/CTS
options.B: Mandatory only if the receiver is the Access Point
options.C: Mandatory after waiting a NAV time
options.D: Mandatory if frame reception is correct

correct_answer_content: Mandatory if frame reception is correct
hint: In the 802.11 standard, due to the high error probability of the wireless medium, every unicast frame must be explicitly acknowledged at the MAC layer.

question: A source sends 12 PDUs using a Go-Back-N protocol with transmission window equal to 5 PDUs, numbering them starting from 1. The first ACK is received after completing transmission of packet 5 and is ACK 2. Knowing that no timeout has expired, which action follows:

options.A: The source sends packet 3
options.B: The source sends packet 6
options.C: No action
options.D: The source retransmits packet 2

correct_answer_content: The source sends packet 6
hint: In GBN, ACK 2 is cumulative and indicates that packets 1 and 2 have been received. The window (initially [1,2,3,4,5]) slides two positions forward to [3,4,5,6,7]. The sender can then proceed to send packet 6.

question: Removing a bidirectional channel from a ring topology, the resulting topology:

options.A: Becomes a tree topology
options.B: Becomes a passive star topology
options.C: Remains a ring topology
options.D: Becomes an active star topology

correct_answer_content: Becomes a tree topology
hint: A ring is a connected graph where every node has a degree of 2. Removing an edge breaks the cycle but leaves the graph connected, becoming a "bus" (a type of linear tree).

question: In data transmission over a radio channel, it is preferable to use:

options.A: A polar line coding like Manchester coding to facilitate clock recovery
options.B: An nBmB type line coding to reduce bandwidth occupation
options.C: A unipolar line coding to guarantee the DC component necessary for transmission
options.D: A digital modulation like 64-QAM to be able to transmit in the appropriate frequency band

correct_answer_content: A digital modulation like 64-QAM to be able to transmit in the appropriate frequency band
hint: For radio transmissions, modulation (such as QAM) is essential to shift the signal to the antenna frequency and to optimize spectral efficiency.

question: A host must send a 4800-byte file using 800-byte PDUs with 100-byte PCI. What size is the last PDU sent?

options.A: 900 bytes
options.B: 100 bytes
options.C: 700 bytes
options.D: 800 bytes

correct_answer_content: 700 bytes
hint: Each PDU carries 800 - 100 = 700 bytes of data. For 4800 bytes, 4800 / 700 = 6.85 packets are needed. That is 6 full packets (800 bytes total) and a final one. The remaining data is 4800 - (6 * 700) = 600 bytes. The size of the last PDU is 600 (data) + 100 (PCI) = 700 bytes.

question: IP datagram segmentation is an example of:

options.A: Generation of multiple 3-SDUs from one 3-PDU
options.B: Generation of multiple 2-SDUs from one 3-SDU
options.C: Generation of multiple 3-PDUs from one 3-SDU
options.D: Generation of multiple 2-SDUs from one 3-PDU

correct_answer_content: Generation of multiple 3-PDUs from one 3-SDU
hint: IP fragmentation takes one Layer 3 Service Data Unit (the original packet) and generates multiple Layer 3 Protocol Data Units (the fragments).

question: In a virtual circuit packet switching network, the number of labels used by a node for routing is proportional to:

options.A: The number of possible sources
options.B: The sum of the average number of input and output channels from each node
options.C: The number of active connections
options.D: The number of possible destinations

correct_answer_content: The number of active connections
hint: In a virtual circuit network, each active connection has its own identifier (label or VCI) local to the link, so the switching tables grow with the number of established circuits.

question: In which of the following protocols is no form of error detection provided:

options.A: Ethernet
options.B: IEEE 802.2 LLC (Logical Link Control)
options.C: PPP (Point-to-point Protocol)
options.D: IEEE 802.3

correct_answer_content: IEEE 802.2 LLC (Logical Link Control)
hint: IEEE 802.2 LLC (Type 1) provides connectionless service without error detection or flow control; these functions are typically delegated to higher layers.

question: In case an error in router forwarding table configuration generates a closed path in the network, which of these statements is true?

options.A: A datagram can circulate on such path indefinitely
options.B: The spanning tree protocol prevents these problems from arising before they occur
options.C: A datagram circulating on such path is eventually eliminated by routers, which identify it by comparing its content with copies maintained in local cache
options.D: A datagram circulating on such path is eventually eliminated by routers based on the TTL field

correct_answer_content: A datagram circulating on such path is eventually eliminated by routers based on the TTL field
hint: The Time To Live (TTL) field is decremented by each router. If the packet enters a loop, the TTL eventually reaches zero, and the router discards it.

question: A playout delay of 2 seconds:

options.A: Is compatible with streaming stored content but not for VoIP
options.B: Is compatible with both streaming stored content and VoIP
options.C: Is not compatible with either streaming stored content or VoIP
options.D: Is compatible with VoIP but not for streaming stored content

correct_answer_content: Is compatible with streaming stored content but not for VoIP
hint: Playout buffers of 2 seconds are excellent for smoothing out jitter in non-interactive streaming, but would make real-time conversation (VoIP) impossible.

question: Which of these statements regarding UDP is true?

options.A: UDP automatically retransmits datagrams for which no acknowledgment has been received
options.B: UDP implements flow control but not congestion control
options.C: UDP implements both flow control and congestion control
options.D: UDP allows multiplexing/demultiplexing thanks to the port concept

correct_answer_content: UDP allows multiplexing/demultiplexing thanks to the port concept
hint: UDP is a connectionless protocol that uses source and destination ports to direct data to the correct application process.

question: In the byte stuffing procedure:

options.A: The receiver discards every byte that corresponds to the delimiter used by the protocol
options.B: The receiver discards the delimiter used by the protocol that precedes the escape byte
options.C: The receiver discards the escape byte that precedes the delimiter used by the protocol
options.D: The receiver discards every byte that corresponds to the escape byte used by the protocol

correct_answer_content: The receiver discards the escape byte that precedes the delimiter used by the protocol
hint: During the de-stuffing process, the receiver identifies the escape byte, removes it, and treats the following byte as literal data.

question: In case of stations all within radio range of each other, which of the following statements about comparing Aloha and CSMA protocols is true?

options.A: Unlike CSMA, a station transmitting using Aloha needs a reception acknowledgment
options.B: Unlike Aloha, a station using CSMA never collides with a transmission started more than the maximum propagation delay ago
options.C: Aloha transmissions can start at any time, while in CSMA they must be preceded by a channel reservation slot
options.D: Unlike Aloha, in CSMA a station never collides with other stations

correct_answer_content: Unlike Aloha, a station using CSMA never collides with a transmission started more than the maximum propagation delay ago
hint: CSMA senses the carrier. After the propagation delay, all other stations will see the channel as "busy" and will not start a new transmission.

question: Which of the following statements is true, considering classic IP router operations (excluding firewall, NAT, etc.)?

options.A: A router modifies at least one IP address of packets it must transmit
options.B: A router uses ICMP messages to determine the path to follow to reach a host belonging to the internet network
options.C: An IP router uses ARP (address resolution protocol) to know the IP address of the router to write as destination address in the IP packet
options.D: A router modifies at least one MAC address of packets containing IP, but not the IP addresses

correct_answer_content: A router modifies at least one MAC address of packets containing IP, but not the IP addresses
hint: A router strips the Layer 2 header and builds a new one with its own MAC as the source and the next hop's MAC as the destination, but the original source/destination IP addresses remain unchanged.

question: How many hosts can be managed at most in a network with netmask 255.255.255.128?
hint: A .128 mask leaves 7 bits for the host part ($2^7 = 128$). Subtracting the network and broadcast addresses gives 126 usable hosts.

question: If a node using a windowing protocol receives an out-of-sequence PDU with incorrect parity bits:

options.A: Discards the PDU and sends no ACK
options.B: Sends an ACK relative to the sequence number contained in the PDU but discards the PDU
options.C: Discards the PDU and sends an ACK of the expected sequence number
options.D: Inserts the PDU in memory if it falls within the receive window, without sending any ACK

correct_answer_content: Discards the PDU and sends no ACK
hint: If the PDU has error bits, it is considered invalid and must be discarded. No ACK is sent because the receiver cannot trust the information in the PDU.

question: A frame received by an Ethernet card of a switch is processed to decide its routing:

options.A: Only if the destination MAC address is broadcast
options.B: Only if the unicast destination MAC address corresponds to that of the switch
options.C: Always, whatever the destination address
options.D: Only if the destination MAC address is multicast and the switch belongs to the corresponding multicast group

correct_answer_content: Always, whatever the destination address
hint: Switches examine every incoming frame to learn MAC addresses and determine the correct output port based on their switching table.

question: Compared to 1-persistent CSMA, non-persistent CSMA provides that:

options.A: After a collision, wait a random time before trying to transmit
options.B: The new listening of the channel, if found busy, occurs after a random time
options.C: Wait a random time and then send the frame on the channel
options.D: Transmission occurs as soon as the channel becomes free

correct_answer_content: The new listening of the channel, if found busy, occurs after a random time
hint: In non-persistent CSMA, if the station senses a busy channel, it waits a random time before sensing again, which reduces the probability of a collision when the channel becomes free.

question: The ICMP (Internet Control Message Protocol) protocol allows:

options.A: Exchange of error messages between routers and hosts
options.B: Transfer of email messages between host and host
options.C: Exchange of error messages between TCP protocol and IP protocol
options.D: Transfer of a web page from a server to a client

correct_answer_content: Exchange of error messages between routers and hosts
hint: ICMP is a support protocol for the IP layer used to send error reports and operational information.

question: In the TCP header, i.e., in the PCI of the TCP protocol, are mandatorily contained:

options.A: Some flags used for opening and closing the connection
options.B: The current value of the congestion window
options.C: The header checksum field, for error detection on the header only
options.D: The Maximum Segment Size value negotiated between transmitter and receiver

correct_answer_content: Some flags used for opening and closing the connection
hint: The TCP header contains 6 control flags (SYN, ACK, FIN, etc.) used for state management. The checksum covers both the header and the data.

question: In an ARQ (Automatic Retransmission Request) scheme with non-cyclic numbering, with window Wt > 1, the number of the first packet in the transmission window can refer to:

options.A: None of the other answers
options.B: A packet transmitted by the transmitter, received by the receiver and for which the transmitter has received the corresponding ACK
options.C: A packet for which the receiver has no space in the buffer
options.D: A packet transmitted by the transmitter, received by the receiver and for which the transmitter has not yet received the corresponding ACK

correct_answer_content: A packet transmitted by the transmitter, received by the receiver and for which the transmitter has not yet received the corresponding ACK
hint: The transmission window represents the set of packets that have been sent but are still "in flight" or not yet acknowledged by the receiver.

question: In the CSMA-CD protocol a station completes transmission of a frame:

options.A: Only if it has higher priority than the station it collides with
options.B: Only if, listening to the channel, no simultaneous reception to the ongoing transmission is detected
options.C: Always after starting it
options.D: Only if it receives an ACK frame from the receiver

correct_answer_content: Only if, listening to the channel, no simultaneous reception to the ongoing transmission is detected
hint: CSMA-CD stations monitor the medium while transmitting. If they detect a collision (simultaneous signal), they stop and send a jam signal.

question: If a node using a Selective Repeat protocol receives a PDU with sequence number within the receive window with incorrect parity bits:

options.A: Discards the PDU and sends no ACK
options.B: Discards the PDU and sends an ACK of the expected sequence number

correct_answer_content: Discards the PDU and sends no ACK
hint: Any corrupted PDU is simply discarded. In Selective Repeat, the receiver only ACKs correct segments.

question: Which of these CANNOT be a network ID:
hint: In a /16 network, the first two octets are the network part. The ID should be 130.192.0.0. 130.192.55.0/16 represents a specific host address, not the network identifier.

question: A source must send 6 PDUs using a Go-Back-N protocol with cumulative ACKs and transmission window equal to 3 PDUs, numbering them starting from 1. After transmission of the first window, and before timeout expiration, the only acknowledgment received is ACK 3. Which of the following actions is plausible to be executed by the source:

options.A: The source retransmits PDU 2
options.B: The source sends PDUs 3 and 4
options.C: The source sends PDUs 4 and 5
options.D: The source sends nothing more and waits for timeout expiration

correct_answer_content: The source sends PDUs 4 and 5
hint: Cumulative ACK 3 means packets 1, 2, and 3 were successfully received. The window slides forward, allowing the source to send packets 4, 5, and 6.

question: Which field in the IP header is used to prevent a packet from being forwarded by more than N routers?

options.A: Destination address
options.B: Version
options.C: None of the answers

correct_answer_content: None of the answers
hint: The correct field is the TTL (Time To Live), which is not listed in the options.

question: In a WiFi network the use of RTS/CTS messages:

options.A: Eliminates collisions with other stations
options.B: Reduces the probability of collision between stations

correct_answer_content: Reduces the probability of collision between stations
hint: RTS/CTS helps mitigate the "hidden terminal" problem, but collisions can still occur on the RTS frames themselves or due to other interference.

question: Which of the following statements about NAT is true?

options.A: NAT uses an IP address/port combination to create associations between internal hosts and internet destinations
options.B: Port forwarding is necessary to allow communication between internal network hosts toward the internet
options.C: NAT dynamically assigns IP addresses to internal network hosts that request them
options.D: It is always possible to contact internal network hosts from the internet, without particular additional solutions

correct_answer_content: NAT uses an IP address/port combination to create associations between internal hosts and internet destinations
hint: NAPT (Network Address Port Translation) maps multiple private IP addresses to a single public IP by using unique source port numbers.

question: Which of the following is not a network ID?
hint: For a /16 prefix, the network identifier must be 192.168.0.0.

question: A router can be associated with:

options.A: Only one IP address
options.B: Multiple IP addresses

correct_answer_content: Multiple IP addresses
hint: A router has multiple interfaces, and each active interface is assigned its own unique IP address.

question: The Aloha protocol starts transmitting:

options.A: After listening to the channel, finding it free
options.B: Regardless of channel state

correct_answer_content: Regardless of channel state
hint: Pure Aloha does not perform carrier sensing; it transmits as soon as a frame is ready.

question: The byte stuffing technique in the PPP protocol serves to:

options.A: Separate the header from the data field
options.B: Correctly detect the beginning and end of the frame

correct_answer_content: Correctly detect the beginning and end of the frame
hint: It allows the protocol to use a specific flag byte as a delimiter while ensuring the same byte value appearing in the data part doesn't prematurely end the frame.

question: Which of these statements regarding HTTP 1.1 protocol is true?

options.A: HTTP 1.1 is based on a client-server paradigm
options.B: HTTP 1.1 uses UDP at the transport layer
options.C: HTTP 1.1 is natively stateful (not stateless)
options.D: HTTP 1.1 messages use binary encoding

correct_answer_content: HTTP 1.1 is based on a client-server paradigm
hint: HTTP is a request-response protocol based on the client-server model and typically runs over TCP.

question: The fragmentation operation performed by IPv4 routers is an example of:

options.A: Generation of multiple 2-SDUs from one 3-SDU
options.B: Generation of multiple 3-SDUs from one 3-PDU
options.C: Generation of multiple 3-PDUs from one 3-SDU
options.D: Generation of multiple 2-SDUs from one 3-PDU

correct_answer_content: Generation of multiple 3-PDUs from one 3-SDU
hint: Fragmentation takes a Layer 3 SDU (the data) and creates multiple smaller Layer 3 PDUs (the fragments) to fit the MTU of the next link.

question: Associating a dynamic cost instead of a static cost to a transmission channel:

options.A: Can cause frequent modifications of the path chosen from a source to a destination
options.B: Avoids possible oscillations in path choice caused by cost variation over time
options.C: Is preferable in case of packet switching but not in circuit switching
options.D: Reduces variations in path choice from a source to a destination

correct_answer_content: Can cause frequent modifications of the path chosen from a source to a destination
hint: Dynamic costs (like current load) can cause "routing oscillations" where paths change frequently as load shifts, potentially leading to instability.

question: Consider a network consisting of transmitter, intermediate node and receiver. There are 2 packets (10ms each) arriving at intermediate node at t=20ms. The output channel has double speed. At what time is transmission completed?

options.A: 40ms
options.B: 50ms
options.C: 45ms
options.D: 70ms

correct_answer_content: 45ms
hint: Packet 1 is fully received at 30ms; its transmission to the receiver (double speed) takes 5ms (total 35ms). Packet 2 is fully received at 40ms; its transmission takes 5ms (total 45ms).

question: A node sends 2200 bytes of data, using 900-byte PDUs with 100-byte PCI, on a 4Mbit/s channel. Time needed for the last packet?

options.A: 1.4ms
options.B: 1.8ms
options.C: 1ms
options.D: 5ms

correct_answer_content: 1.4ms
