hint: Data per packet = 800 bytes. 2200 = 800+800+600. Last packet is 600 (data) + 100 (PCI) = 700 bytes (5600 bits). $5600 / 4,000,000 = 1.4ms$.

question: Given a 100Mbit/s channel with 2 TCP (30Mbit/s) and 2 UDP (40Mbit/s) connections. Which is correct?

options.A: UDP connections block TCP connections
options.B: TCP connections have a transmission speed of 25Mbit/s, due to TCP Fairness
options.C: UDP connections have a transmission speed of 30Mbit/s, due to TCP congestion control
options.D: TCP connections have a transmission speed of 10Mbit/s

correct_answer_content: TCP connections have a transmission speed of 10Mbit/s
hint: UDP connections do not react to congestion and take 80Mbit/s total. The remaining 20Mbit/s is shared by the 2 TCP connections (10Mbit/s each).

question: Bluetooth:

options.A: Uses frequency hopping spread spectrum modulation short-range radio transmission ISM band connected to a Master node in star topology
options.B: Uses frequency hopping spread spectrum modulation long-range radio transmission High band
options.C: Is used only by mobile telephony for transmission

correct_answer_content: Uses frequency hopping spread spectrum modulation short-range radio transmission ISM band connected to a Master node in star topology
hint: Bluetooth operates in the 2.4 GHz ISM band and organizes devices into piconets using a master/slave star architecture.

question: Which of these is false for VoIP?

options.A: RTP provides mechanisms to guarantee real-time delivery
options.B: RTP can be used for audio/video transfer
options.C: SIP can be used to open and close a session
options.D: SIP provides mechanisms to determine the called party's address

correct_answer_content: RTP provides mechanisms to guarantee real-time delivery
hint: RTP provides timing and sequencing, but it is a "best-effort" protocol over UDP; it cannot guarantee delivery or timing by itself.

question: Selective repeat with Wt=Wr=4, receiver receives PDUs 0,2,3. After the first reception of PDU 3, what sequence does the receiver see arriving?
hint: In Selective Repeat, the receiver buffers 0, 2, and 3. It is only waiting for PDU 1 to complete the window and deliver data to the higher layer.

question: What is the speed of WiFi technology nowadays?

options.A: Hundreds of Gigabit/s
options.B: On the order of Tbit/s
options.C: A few Gigabit/s
options.D: Tens of Mbit/s

correct_answer_content: A few Gigabit/s
hint: Modern Wi-Fi standards like Wi-Fi 6 (802.11ax) and Wi-Fi 7 reach theoretical speeds of several Gbps.

question: The FTTx residential access network consists of:

options.A: A passive optical fiber distribution network and, optionally, a terminal segment in copper
options.B: Always entirely of an active optical fiber distribution network
options.C: A passive copper distribution network and, optionally, a terminal segment in optical fiber
options.D: An optical distribution network based on IEEE 802.3 Gigabit Ethernet technology

correct_answer_content: A passive optical fiber distribution network and, optionally, a terminal segment in copper
hint: FTTx (Fiber-to-the-x) typically uses PON (Passive Optical Network) technology. Depending on whether it is FTTC or FTTH, the final segment may be copper or fiber.

question: A 16-QAM digital modulation:

options.A: Provides for sending 16 bits every symbol time
options.B: Provides for sending 4 bits every symbol time
options.C: Provides for sending 4 symbols every bit time
options.D: Provides for sending 16 symbols every bit time

correct_answer_content: Provides for sending 4 bits every symbol time
hint: In 16-QAM, there are 16 possible states ($2^4$), meaning each symbol carries 4 bits of information.

question: Servers that implement the distributed DNS database store resource records:

options.A: Type A record serves to obtain an IP address given the host name
options.B: CNAME record serves to obtain the canonical name of a mail server
options.C: Type A record serves to provide requesting hosts the canonical name relative to a host name

correct_answer_content: Type A record serves to obtain an IP address given the host name
hint: An 'A' record (Address) maps a domain name to its corresponding IPv4 address. CNAME is for aliases, and MX is for mail servers.

question: Which of the following statements regarding a standard IP router (without additional functionality like firewall, NAT...):

options.A: The router modifies at least one IP address of the packets
options.B: The router forwards datagrams using frames, the outgoing frame has at least one different MAC address compared to the incoming frame
options.C: Hosts communicate always passing through a router

correct_answer_content: The router forwards datagrams using frames, the outgoing frame has at least one different MAC address compared to the incoming frame
hint: A router strips the old Layer 2 header and adds a new one. The source MAC becomes the router's interface MAC, and the destination MAC becomes the next hop's MAC.

question: In the context of LS routing algorithms, a node's routing table:

options.A: Is used to calculate the minimum cost path to other nodes
options.B: Is compiled once the minimum cost path to other nodes is known

correct_answer_content: Is compiled once the minimum cost path to other nodes is known
hint: Link-State algorithms (like Dijkstra) first calculate the shortest path tree; the results are then used to populate the routing/forwarding table.

question: Port numbers in layer 4 protocols:

options.A: Are present only in UDP
options.B: Are present only in TCP
options.C: Are present in both UDP and TCP
options.D: Do not concern UDP and TCP protocols

correct_answer_content: Are present in both UDP and TCP
hint: Both TCP and UDP use 16-bit port numbers to identify specific application processes (multiplexing/demultiplexing).

question: In a system with WIFI 802.11 protocol, two terminals A and B transmit simultaneously, what can happen?:

options.A: Terminal B terminates transmission when it receives a NACK (Negative ACK)
options.B: Terminal B waits to receive an ack

correct_answer_content: Terminal B waits to receive an ack
hint: 802.11 does not have collision detection (CD) during transmission. If a collision occurs, the sender simply won't receive an ACK and will retry after a timeout.

question: Adding a bidirectional channel between two nodes of a tree topology what happens:

options.A: Always creates a ring
options.B: Creates a cycle

correct_answer_content: Creates a cycle
hint: By definition, a tree is a connected graph without cycles. Adding any edge between two existing nodes creates exactly one cycle.

question: In classless addressing what is the prefix length in a network composed of 512 IP addresses?
hint: A network with 512 addresses ($2^9$) needs 9 bits for the host part. $32 - 9 = 23$, so the prefix is /23.

question: DNS:

options.A: Uses UDP to resolve names to IP addresses
options.B: Is a distributed server

correct_answer_content: Uses UDP to resolve names to IP addresses
hint: DNS primarily uses UDP port 53 for queries because it is fast and low-overhead.

question: DHCP:

options.A: Configures IP network parameters on the local network
options.B: Configures any network that requests it

correct_answer_content: Configures IP network parameters on the local network
hint: DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol) is used to automatically assign IP addresses and other parameters within a local subnet.

question: In the ALOHA protocol all stations use frames of the same duration, a station sends a frame that starts at time t0 + 1100 and ends at time t0 + 1300. At which of the following start times of a transmission by another station does a collision occur:
hint: The vulnerable period is $2 \times \text{frame duration}$ (400 units). Any frame starting between $1100 - 200 = 900$ and 1300 will collide. $t0 + 910$ falls in this range.

question: Using Selective Repeat with transmission window 10, numbering packets starting from 0, transmits the following sequence: 4 5 6, acquiring reception of ACK 9. Assuming sequential channel and cumulative ACKs, which statement is true:

options.A: Can transmit PDU 19
options.B: Transmits PDU 8
options.C: Transmits PDU 7
options.D: Can transmit PDU 18

correct_answer_content: Can transmit PDU 18
hint: ACK 9 implies all packets up to 9 are received. The window of 10 starts at 10. The allowed sequence numbers are $10 \dots 19$ (10 slots). Therefore, it can send up to PDU 18.

question: In the introduction to subnet masks in Internet addressing:

options.A: Allows subdividing a class B network into multiple physical networks
options.B: Allows using a single IP logical network on multiple physical networks

correct_answer_content: Allows subdividing a class B network into multiple physical networks
hint: Subnetting allows administrators to break a large network block (like a Class B) into smaller, manageable logical segments matching physical segments.

question: Which statement about traceroute is false:

options.A: It uses IP TTL field
options.B: Special application TRACERT on TCP connection is used
options.C: It uses ICMP echo request messages
options.D: It uses variable number of messages

correct_answer_content: Special application TRACERT on TCP connection is used
hint: Traceroute uses UDP or ICMP, not a persistent TCP connection.

question: What frames does a switch on Ethernet 802.3ab usually receive?

options.A: Unicast frames from default LAN router, whatever MAC address, and broadcast or multicast frames from default router
options.B: Unicast frames from terminal connected to the same switch, whatever the MAC address, and only broadcast or multicast frame among terminal connected to the same switch
options.C: Unicast frames from terminal connected to the same switch, whatever the MAC address, and only broadcast or multicast frame among terminal connected to the same router
options.D: Unicast frames from terminal connected to the same switch with MAC address of the switch and only broadcast or multicast frame among terminal connected to the same router

correct_answer_content: Unicast frames from terminal connected to the same switch, whatever the MAC address, and only broadcast or multicast frame among terminal connected to the same switch
hint: A switch's port receives all frames physically sent to it; it then filters or forwards based on the MAC table.

question: VLANs are used to:

options.A: Logically separate physically connected network segment by configuring a local router
options.B: Physically separate logically connected network segment by configuring a local switch
options.C: Logically separate physically connected network segment by configuring a local switch
options.D: Physically separate logically connected network segment by configuring a local router

correct_answer_content: Logically separate physically connected network segment by configuring a local switch
hint: VLANs create separate broadcast domains on the same physical switch hardware.

question: TCP connection synchronizes before data transmission by:

options.A: One-way hand shake
options.B: Two-way hand shake
options.C: Three-way hand shake
options.D: Four-way handshake

correct_answer_content: Three-way hand shake
hint: TCP uses the SYN, SYN-ACK, ACK sequence to establish a connection.

question: Which of the following line encodings does at least one signal transition per symbol period?

options.A: Bipolar
options.B: NRZ
options.C: RZ
options.D: nBmB

correct_answer_content: RZ
hint: RZ (Return-to-Zero) ensures a transition back to zero in every bit period.

question: Which error forwarding technique uses the most physical space when used to send 12 byte data?

options.A: Double repeat per byte
options.B: One parity bit per byte
options.C: Row and column parity bits when the data is organized into a matrix with 1 byte per row
options.D: One checksum per 16-bit chunks

correct_answer_content: Double repeat per byte
hint: Double repetition effectively doubles the data size (100% overhead). Parity and checksums add only a few bits or bytes of overhead.
